Reviews.Title: “sunshine views”
Reviews.Author: bruce h
Reviews.Content: my wife, two younger sons and i stayed there for 3day/2night. mon/wed. sept9th/12th. awsome pool. great staff. cheap old fashion soda "40cents". free coffee/hotchoc. anytime. 10cent gumballs. clean room and bath. cost to stay was low which allowed for more spending on the kids. the front porch offered great views. the hotel was located in the center of all boardwalk action. with out of season stay the place was relaxing and slow. O.C. is great to visit after kids go back to school!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: Marcus P
Reviews.Content: It really was not that bad as everybody puts up. I mean come on. how much time are you really spending in your room? The nice thing is that if it does rain they have a covered patio you can sit out on and drink and watch people get soaked. Its right on the beach so you can just head out the door to the beach which is really nice! Now some cons. We were on the top floor which is not bad but, for the hot water to make it up there you have to have the shower and the sink running at the same time for well over 5 minutes. The bathroom was nasty. Straight up nasty. I will post pictures so its a proven fact. There was hair stuck to the wall from the last "cleaning". There is also dirt in the grout on the floor.. I can understand stained grout but there was dirt in there grout. Dirt where the tile ends and the wall paper begins. There are my biggest cons. Would I stay there again? for the value yes.But I would not mind spending a bit more for a cleaner place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 718momof1
Reviews.Content: Harrison Hall is a great place to stay while in Ocean City if you are looking for a less expensive hotel. I stayed there with my 9 year old daughter for a week in August. It's right on the boardwalk and close to a lot of shops and restaurants. It is an older hotel, but has a very "homey" feel. The hotel staff was friendly, we had plenty of towels and the room was serviced everyday. The pool is nice. My favorite part of the hotel is the front porch - it was so peaceful sitting on the porch and looking at the ocean and watching the people on the boardwalk. It is not a luxury hotel by any means and the price reflects that, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann P
Reviews.Content: Staff not very friendly. Sheets looked dirty hair and dirt in bed. Not very nice towels and not enough. The hotel is old needs lots of updateing. Shower barely had water coming out. Thank goodness we stayed only one night. We will not stay there again. The only reason it got 2 stars is location on boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures can be deceiving...”
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrison hotel for the first time this year after spending the past years staying at the shoreham hotel, we thought we would upgrade and stay at a "nicer" place, after I looked at the website I booked the vacation. PROS: Right on the boardwalk/ vending machines (cheap soda's) / nice size adult pool and also a kiddie pool/ bathtub in room. CONS: Parking is VERY limited/ only 1 elevator for 4 floors/ elevator is VERY small/ bathroom is small/ rooms are small/ rooms are smelly/ hallways are smelly. We had a room with 2 double beds at the bottom of one of the beds was a shape area of metal that I scraped my leg on twice, my husband thought he fixed the problem and then he got scrached by it and then my son, thank goodness we brought our first aid kit along. When we first arrived we have no idea where to check in at, I had to call the front desk from our car they have a very small parking area up front and it was of course full so we had to park 2 blocks away. CONCLUSSION: If you have children I wouldn't suggest staying here, you wait a while for the elevator with a stroller and kids don't like to wait.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: JANET S
Reviews.Content: Great view of the ocean--Parked the car (they provide a pass)- never had to drive--- everything in walking distance--the pool was the largest I had swam in---But the Front Porch is the best-- it is a nice place to just sit and people watch or to look at the ocean--you meet the nicest people--then you dont have to leave the hotel hjust go to the resatraunt that is on the premises

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired and worn out”
Reviews.Author: cagandpag
Reviews.Content: Tried Harrison Hall based on the location and a friends recommendation from a stay several years previously. First, the good. Staff was friendly. Location is excellent on the boardwalk and beach. The wide front porch is a nice place for people watching except for all the smokers. Now the not so good. The physical facility is showing its age and lack of updating badly. Carpets are dingy. Bathroom fixtures very dated and showing use damages. Plumbing for shower could not control the mix of hot and cold very well and made for an interesting hot and then cold then hot shower. This could actually be dangerous. Overall, this seems like a facility waiting to be sold to a large chain hotel for tear down and rebuild.

Reviews.Title: “Harrison "Hell" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LC413
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online and let me just say, looks can be deceiving! Aside from housekeeping, the rest of the staff was horrible! The first night of staying there the shower wasn't working and wasn't draining any water. They didn't have any maintenance there to take care of the situation. The room was dirty and smelled like mildew. They only had one elevator for the entire hotel and was barely big enough to fit two people inside with their luggage. This place is definitely over priced! The only thing we liked about this place was the view from the porch, whenever you actually found a chair to sit on. Overall, the trip was amazing but the hotel was horrible. Would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasCheezburger
Reviews.Content: As identified in my review last year i have been stayimg at HARRISON HALL for a number of and always look forward to returning. Why HARRISON HALL? As previouly said LOCATION, LOCATION. LOCATION. Located on 15th street on the Boardwalk. Close to anything you want or need---resturants, including DeVincie"s at hotel (fine dinning inside or on Boardwalk)---entertainment (day/night, adults/kids)---large swimming pool (bar/entertainment)---public transportation (24 hr pass/$3)---great people watching---AND hotel staff, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation spot.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels, in Ocean City, over the years and this one is by far the best. The hotel is clean and staff members are friendly. The hotel has a pool and a bar outside and is so nice when you don't want to deal with the sand. Everthing you need is within walking distance. I couldn't have ask for a better vacation; I have recommended this hotel to all my family and friends and they too have had great experiences. I definitely will be returning to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in oc!”
Reviews.Author: MarieSpearman
Reviews.Content: what a find! the staff and other guests are friendly and you can't best the charm and the amazing porch! location is perfect and unless you go to the beach to hang out in your room there's no reason the rooms aren't big enough. we will never stay anywhere else!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, great updated rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: LBM481
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of June for a soccer tournament. It is a very old hotel but our room was renovated and was nice. The rooms are small but this is a very old hotel. It was clean and the staff was accommodating. We had friends in a non renovated room and I wouldn't have been happy but the renovated rooms were good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service;ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: najeray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July 10. The location was great,right on the beach. They have a beautiful pool. I checked in late(3am) and the accommodated me by allowing me a late check out. The rooms need to be seriously updated but I think they have started remodeling. Because of the room,it was not worth the price I paid,granted,I didn't spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ali32019
Reviews.Content: Wanted to take a moment and thank Michelle (GM) for all the renovations to the hotel. Our room (412) was exactly what we were looking for (a clean room, on the boards & good price on the 4th of July). I would like to personally thank Stanika for handling my last minute call (on my way there) and calling me back to tell me I was set for 2 nights. After meeting her in person, I found her to be a very helpful, friendly and dedicated employee...even after working a double shift!!! I could tell how she spoke to me that she is excited about the work that has been done so far and is proud of her hotel. All the employees (at the front desk) were very helpful and cheerful which makes it enjoyable for us as guests. My only suggestion in our room would be that since nothing can be done about the size, it would be wonderful to have a full length mirror on the wall since the bathroom is so small and its hard to see yourself. Also, at some point, maybe a microwave. Other than that, we had no issues with the hotel or the pool (good job Casey) and we would recommend the hotel (renovated room...lol) to our friends

Reviews.Title: “It has the enduring character you’d expect of a hotel that is 60+ years old.”
Reviews.Author: gigi056
Reviews.Content: Have realistic expectations. Read the reviews and you’ll see they are all over the map - as with ANY property. This fact is significant: People who started coming here 20+ years ago keep returning so there is a huge loyalty factor and there's a reason for that! PROS: Out of the fray of the southern end; great for people-watching; beach access is RIGHT THERE; plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance; helpful, patient, responsive staff (Destani was awesome!); great porch (for us this is preferable to a tiny private concrete balcony); comfortable beds, 40-cent coke machine (!), we arrived early and were able to check in at noon. CONS (they aren't deal-breakers so I list them just to inform): "Rocking" chairs on porch don’t rock, small room and bathroom, limited electrical outlets, only one reading light between beds when one/bed would be better, weak water pressure, clammy air quality in rooms (forget about drying clothes in the room…it won’t happen!); only one tiny elevator to serve 5 floors and no room for extra passengers if someone is moving in or out with a full luggage cart (we used the stairs and congratulated ourselves for getting exercise!) Smoking: Apparently the hotel recently became a non-smoking establishment INSIDE but to appease long-standing smoking clients, smoking is still allowed on the porch. This is unfortunate for non-smokers since there is no sectioned-off area where they can remove themselves from smoke. Ocean breezes somewhat diminish this point but this problem seems easily-rectifiable – and will probably be solved by the time this review appears. While there were many there, I don’t recommend this hotel for families with small children (there just isn't enough room for them to run around inside) and I can’t imagine having more than 2 people in a room. Ditto for couples looking for a romantic stay. That leaves those in the 40+ category. I DO recommend inviting friends/family to join you since surrounding yourselves with people you enjoy can override the hotel’s shortcomings. 4 stars may seem high and while I don't ever see this as a 5-star property, it does well in it's category by adhering to what has worked in the past.

Reviews.Title: “great cheap getaway”
Reviews.Author: millie516
Reviews.Content: I was looking to get away for a cheap weekend, so I went online and saw Harrison Hall, 2 double beds, big pool, GREAT AC, sitting on the porch in the rocking chairs. the beach was right there and perfect, it was a great get away. OK cons: the room was a little small, I had to sleep with my face against a wall but the bed was cozy This room is not setup for a family so don't expect a huge room.

Reviews.Title: “Won't take family back there”
Reviews.Author: JRPenn
Reviews.Content: I got what I paid for. Most of the reviews I read I believed Harrison Hall would be a great place to take the family. Not so much. I did not expect to spend a lot of time in my room. We were there for the beach and all the fun places Ocean City has to offer. The Pro's: 1) Right on the boardwalk. Great location 2) The pool is great! Daughter LOVED it. I enjoyed my time in it as well. 3) Front porch is great to relax. 4) We had a nice view of the Boardwalk and Ocean. 5) Staff was nice. The Con's: 1) Small rooms. All we could get was a double and a single. (I did book only 10 days before arriving). We were early for check in and were to be called when the room was ready but recieved no call. (We arrived at 1pm and didn't get into room until after 4pm) I asked but there were no other rooms available. 2) Beds were well used and uncomfortable (This from a guy that has slept in a hole in the sand in several combat areas. The holes had more comfort) 3) The bathroom was TINY. The shower--Smaller still. ( I am 6'3" and 280lbs.) I still dont understand what the purpose of a heat lamp that doesn't move and doesn't heat anything but the wall. 4) Electrical outlets only had one plug working in most cases. 5) Elevator was horrible. We used it once. It was faster to walk the stairs. 6) VERY THIN WALLS. I knew the neighbors plans better than my own. This is a hotel for a single guy just looking for a place to sleep and shower(provided he is short and tiny) to go out and look for girls. If you are taking a family spend a bit more and book a place for familys.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: spearman14
Reviews.Content: Wow how have we not discovered this gem before! 15th st on the boardwal k with a giant porch and plenty of rocking chairs to people/wave watch. Room were nice staff was extremely friendly. We actually booked another stay while we were there for a car show at the end of september.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Tess H
Reviews.Content: Let's begin.... 1. Pulling up to a raggedy sign outside of hotel. 2. Check-in, elevator tiny not made for many, cart luggage raggedy and outdated, lobby old fashion outdated with a smell. 3. Room...hallway outdated with smell, carpet dirty, yucky, roach found, bathroom disgusting w/ sign that says can you please reuse your towels!!! 4.Heated lamp for hot water, sink big enough for one hand. 5.Chair in room raggedy, bed skirt ripped with stains.(which made not get a wink of sleep). 6.Next morning heated lamp not enough for hot water. Best review is nothing. please take my advice website pictures aren't the present pictures maybe reflects when hotel first opened. color of hotel not white yellow and dirty. don't stay here ever!! Ms. Tess

Reviews.Title: “Read this before considering Harrison Hall”
Reviews.Author: Marisa F
Reviews.Content: Once I walked into the hotel lobby I knew things would be going downhill from here. I proceeded to the front desk to retrieve my keys for a room on the 5th floor. After opening the door, I was welcomed with an awful smell. I pulled back one part of the bed only to see a brown stain on the sheet. I was on my way back to the front desk to possibly see if I could get my room changed but I realized I misplaced one of the room keys. After search for the key my friend noticed several bugs and chips located underneath the bed. I spoke with the manager and she stated that housekeeping marked the room as clean but her system did not reflect that. The beds were made and fresh towels were laid out so my guess is that they cleaned the room they just did a poor job. I was placed in another room located on the fourth floor but this wasn’t any better. After walking up several steps (due to the elevator not working) I was yet again greeted with the smell of smoke when I thought this was a nonsmoking area. Once I got into the room I noticed the chair was raggedy, the place was very dusty, and the overall appearance was poor. The next day I met a few friends at the beach (who came from out of town) and after coming back around 5 pm, I noticed my room still wasn’t clean. I called the front desk again and they said someone would be up shortly. The lady did come but with an attitude. She told me that she works nights and it really wasn’t her responsibility to clean but she could give me fresh sheets and towels. I told her the room really needed to be cleaned and she agreed to do it after mumbling while walking away. After that discussion I then left again with my friends and came back around 10 pm to shower and get dressed for a night out on the town. We didn’t make it out after noticing we didn’t have an iron or an ironing board. So I called the front desk yet again and they told me I would have to come down and get the iron and ironing board because they are not provided in every room. I am not a picky person but overall my stay here was terrible. The pictures on the website are not the same at all. If I would have seen what the rooms REALLY looked like I would have NOT stayed here. I didn’t have a choice but to stay here because all rooms in Ocean City were sold out for the weekend. Please take my experience and DO NOT stay at this hotel I promise you will not be satisfied. I could go on and on but this pretty much sums up my stay. I will be reporting the Harrison Hall to high authorities.

Reviews.Title: “For 90 bucks on the boardwalk, its not the ritz but it's clean, friendly staff, and on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Jeffsterl
Reviews.Content: It's an old building, but it's clean, rooms are comfortable (some are small) but its a good value and right on the boardwalk at 15th street.

Reviews.Title: “Harrison Hall not as bad as people make it out to be.”
Reviews.Author: Todd L
Reviews.Content: Hello, I have been staying @ Harrison hall for over a decade now. My daughter will not let me stay anywhere else when in OC. Its a little old and run down but for what you are paying to be right on the boards in OC you cant beat it. Pool is beautiful and Davinci’s restaurant is in the basement. Pretty good Italian dinner. And then a block away you have Franco pizza Peppers tavern. When you go to the beach I go for the sun/beach and outdoor cuisine. They hotel is only a place to sleep and you can save some cash if you don’t mind a older hotel. I will be back this year for the 4th of July. Best place in OC for the 4th celebration! This is my opnion. If you are to good for a simple place to stay and want you hiny kissed go elseware.

Reviews.Title: “please read this review”
Reviews.Author: Bob R
Reviews.Content: If confined areas make you feel uncomfortable – do not book a room here. Rooms are small, bathrooms are very small. If you want hot water, start running water about 15 minutes prior to actually getting a shower, and don't turn around in the shower or you may turn off the water by bumping into the water faucet. Electrical outlet covers are cut off to fit the wall. Screens missing from windows,(legal violation?) No easy access to electrical outlets in room. Very uncomfortable chair to sit on. You can only watch TV if you are on the beds. Staff seemed friendly and the front porch and complimentary coffee are the only high-lights to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me!”
Reviews.Author: Beachloverbritt
Reviews.Content: 2 of my friends and I went down for the weekend, this place was old but , other than that it was perfect, the only thing we had a Problem with was our shower leaked into the room below us so they made us move all of are neatly organized stuff two rooms down, n then put a couple in the same room with the leaky shower, other than that, the staff never bothered us, we didn't want them in our room an kept the do not disturb sign on our door an they respected it, in all, I would deffinatly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Filth is neither quaint nor charming”
Reviews.Author: Karlar1965
Reviews.Content: Please do not book here. This is my second year at Harrison Hall. Last year I excused the extremely small room with the thought that e would only be sleeping in the room, so the extremely small room ans miniscule shower were somewhat acceptable. Last year was bad but the hotel was closed from January through April of this year for renovations, so we decided to try it again. However this hotel has not been renovated and has deteiorated even more than last year if that is even possible. This year we walked into a horrid musty smell and witnessed the manager sticking air fresheners into the vents (but it didn't help). We opened the door to our room and the cover on the king size bed had large nasty brown stains on it. We asked for a clean cover and were told they didn't have any clean king size spreads and gave us two double spreads and two blankets. There was a large centipede creature crawling on the wall and our toilet backed up with the first flush. If the smell, bugs and disgustingly dirty carpet isn't enough to deter you from booking here, maytbe the sight of the staff blatantly hanging out in the empty rooms will. But if you still think you may get a bargain staying here I leave you with one last thought. We checked in on a Friday and checked out on a Monday and our linen was NEVER changed, not once. In fact the housekeeping service didn't even make up the bed. They just pulled the top sheet up over all the other pillows blankets, or aything else.on the bed. 3 days, dirty sheets, dirty rooms, shower too small to use, broken toilet...need I say more? Both years I stayed the first week of May so they can't even use the summer tourist season as an excuse. The place was a ghost town so they have no excuse. They are just a filthy, nasty establishment. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't reserve thru Hotels.Com”
Reviews.Author: jenika l
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at Harrison Hall thru Hotels.Com. After asking for a room with a water view, I was assured by Hotels.com representative that not only did I have a room with water view reserved but I got the last water view room available. I get to Harrison Hall and go to my room. It faces the parking lot. I call from the room to the Harrison Hall front desk and they say they can give me an ocean front room for more money. I reply that is fine! I go to front desk for keys to another room. When I get to front desk, the front desk staff says that since I booked thru Hotels.com I can't have a water front room. Huh? So, they compromise and give me a water view which means I get mostly parking lot with a little bit of ocean view. There's something wrong here with both the Harrison Hall's and the Hotels.com's policies and representation of what rooms are being reserved. I'm not asking for much, just a little old fashioned honestly. A reservationist also needs to clarify with caller what OCEAN VIEW and OCEAN FRONT is. However, that wasn't the issue since I didn't even have an ocean view at first, only a parking lot. The hotel itself is right on the boardwalk. But for a view of the parking lot, the rooms should be a lot more comfortable and updated. I'm not fauling the front desk staff, I'm sure they are following "policy." But that management really should get a handle on this.

Reviews.Title: “OLD BUT CHARMING”
Reviews.Author: Thomas D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bring our grand children here two times a year. My 11 year old grand daughter thinks this is the best place in the world. She gets ocean sickness(meaning missing O.C.) about mid winter and can't wait to get back to H.H. I must admit we feel the same way. This place is on the boardwalk just steps away from the beach. It has one of the nicest and largest pools in O.C. We hook up with some of the people we have met here over the years and it's like old home week. I must say it's old but has lots of charm. What do you expect for one of the oldest hotels in O.C.

Reviews.Title: “Steve O.”
Reviews.Author: steve_oberti
Reviews.Content: Clean Rooms. Very friendly staff. The front porch was great. We were right on the boardwalk which was very convenient. Overall the room was a great price for the location. I will stay at Harrison Hall again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to Harrison Hall Hotel the day after Labor Day for a week for several years and just love it. The price is reasonable, the rooms are all we need, we love the big front porch with rocking chairs, the lobby with free coffee and fresh fruit and tables to eat your breakfast or lunch, and the really large pool is great. But most of all, we love the staff, particularly the housekeepers. They do an excellent job. This year (2011) my husband has to use a walker, and our room was at the far end of the hall. Our housekeeper said a room right across from the elevator and next to the lobby was becoming available on our 2nd day. We were able to move to that room which was much larger and so much easier for my husband to manage, plus we got it for the same daily rate as the smaller room! One of the male maintenance staff even helped us move.....how great is that?!

Reviews.Title: “Great view but Rooms are much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Elena N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harrison Hotel this past weekend for my 40th Birthday celebration. The actual hotel from the outside is adorable. Rocking chairs on a grande porch looking directly at the ocean, a nice little lobby with coffee, tea and cocoa and the parking was even convenient. I was so disappointed with the room though. It was small and dated, clean but felt dirty. The bathroom was even smaller and you could hardly fit in the oddly shaped shower. The only saving grace was DaVinci's restaurant downstairs. It was delicious! I would not visit again and do not recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “They STOLE $400 from us!!!”
Reviews.Author: will60811
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay there this weekend, but we just found out there is a hurricane approaching Ocean City so when we called to cancel they said we had to have called 3 hours earlier to get our money back. Since we were only 69 hours ahead instead of 72 we are now being charged $400 to cancel. I would agree with the policy in some circumstances, but when there is a natural disaster heading there it is ridiculous that they will not be flexible. I would carefully consider this before calling there, because plenty of other hotels I called said they would refund in this circumstance. We will never be giving them another cent of our money.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Mrsgreen52
Reviews.Content: It is an older Hotel, but on the Board Walk, very clean, friendly staff, Coffee/Hot Chocolate all day available in lobby, and a porch facing the beach with rockers to relax in after eating or walking ect. We also spent time in pool which is very nice, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: mwanyo
Reviews.Content: I was so uncomfortable in this hotel. Stayed 3 nights and barely slept because the beds were so small and I swear they were dirty. After the first night I purposely took all the sheets off and pillowcases and comforter becauce there were nasty orange stains on them, and put them in the hallway for housekeeping to make sure they knew they were filthy and when we got back to our room I inspected our sheets and they were the same one! Same gross stains! I was so grossed out. I called front desk and finally after 4 times they said they would be changed, they came. But who the hell knows if they were clean, staff is rude and all look like crack heads off the street. Only nice part was the pool and the bartender there was the only nice part of thestaff.Neverrrr again. Pictures on website are so deceiving. I even looked at them again after our stay and was still like wow is this the same place. Only reason I didn't complain too much more was because of my 3 year old son. It was his vacation so I sucked it up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was postponed twice this year and when I went to book at the last minute the only place on the boardwalk with 2 double beds for that week in our price range was Harrison Hall. I was scared to go after reading all the bad reviews. Very happy about our experience. The room was small (as pictured) but was clean. It had a large walk in closet with a refrigerator and large storage area above great for beach chairs etc. The pillows were smaller than standard size but you get two so its the same difference. The bathroom was very clean and modern. I had no problem with water temperature but the water pressure is low. They have liquid soap dispensers on the wall so bring your own soap and shampoo if you want more than that. The pool was great with nice a little bar that was open everyday (it didn't rain). The pool chairs weren't broken and rusted they were nice white resin.Everyone on staff (front desk, maids, and bartenders) were very friendly and helpful.I didn't hear excessive noise form other people, the maids came everyday and cleaned the room and halls. They have fruit and coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning so you can have a free breakfast on the front porch and watch all the bikers and joggers go by. Even my husband who pooh poohed the idea of the front porch ended up enjoying it in the evenings before we went to bed.The best part is that you are right on the boardwalk close to all the shopping and restaurants and right on the beach. We liked it so much we are going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Hotel is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mimslyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on 14th street, in the middle of the boardwalk which is perfect! It has a great big, clean pool with a tiki hut that offers drinks. Their staff are extremely courteous, always there to help (ask for Heather, the manager, she's super!). All day long, especially in the morning they have a huge hot coffee maker where you can get decaf or regular with flavored creamers! During the day or at sunset, there are great big rocking chairs on the porch, right above the boardwalk where you can sit and people watch and watch the beach and ocean waves.....relaxing! The lobby has a computer, like a mini business center, and there are a lot of games you can take back to your room and play! The rooms are average, the mattresses/pillows/chairs are in need of replacement and a possible recarpet would make the place comparable to some of the new competition going up around it (beach plaza). BUT, rooms are very clean, otherwise a good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay as far as affordability and proximity to the beach and boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: lbeissel
Reviews.Content: Me and fiancé stayed there last year and again this year and plan on staying again next year. The rooms are no frills- bed, shower, tv and small fridge but for a couple days at the beach what more do you need? The porch and the pool make up for any shortcomings inthe room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: starfly97
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (to play on the beach) and they took my cell phone number and told us they would call us when the room was ready. They called 5 minutes later and told me our room was ready and they had given us an upgrade. The room was nice (ocean view) and the staff was friendly. The only thing that I didn't like was the lack of water pressure in the shower. However that is not anything that Harrison Hall had control over. As I was leaving I booked another vacation of Aug 2011. Nice place and great location for not a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sanfanandre
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this place due to some bad reviews. But the price was right and the location seemed ideal. And boy am I glad to stayed here! The location was awesome! Go just for the porch and the nice oversized rocking chairs! Really nice just relax and watch the ocean. The lobby was very family friendly. Big screen tv, computer with internet access, coffee, tea, fresh fruit, puzzles and games for the kids! My girls, ages 8 and 6 loved going to the lobby to play with the other kids. The pool was nice, clean and big with a nice calm pool bar, again very family friendly. Just like another review, the elevator is very slow and I too, just climbed the stairs. The room is small but hey, you are on vacation, you are basically going to sleep, shower and dress. They do have a good size fridge. Con- wish they had a better ice maker, but again no big deal. We will definately be there again!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE and Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: decadevacationer
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine that there would be a better place to stay on the Boardwalk! This place was great. Incredibly friendly staff, warm and welcoming lobby, great access to beach and large hotel pool with bar..This place is great for families or couples. We loved rocking on the front porch in the early morning and evenings, and even though there were lots of other people there, everyone sort of respected each other's privacy. I thought it was really sweet how they keep games for kids in the lobby, as well as books to borrow, and the wicker furniture was really cute. Harrison Hall will be our "go to" place in Ocean City, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very friendly. I love the porch. The pool is great. Hard to get a chair”
Reviews.Author: Nola61
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and clean, and I enjoyed sitting on the porch each night listening to the ocean. I attened meetings in the morning and in the afternoon it was hard to get a chair at the pool, I will return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location”
Reviews.Author: meobbo1
Reviews.Content: Not the newest property but hard to find a better location. Rocking chairs on the porch almost make the beach a second option. Sit on the porch in the a.m. or p.m. for great people wathcing.

Reviews.Title: “Love the porch!!”
Reviews.Author: kixr4kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6/29 thru 7/2 --the room was clean, including the bathroom-ONLY drawback to the bathroom was the size and there were no hooks or bars to hang wet towels~LOVED sitting on the big rocking chairs on the porch every morn and eve watching the dolphins and the pool/pool area were nicer than places I've stayed at in Stone Harbor and Avalon, NJ--location was definitely a plus--didn't have to move our vehicle from the time we got there till we left-we will definitely book again on our next trip to OC:)

Reviews.Title: “Upon arrival in lower level room we canceled rooms....awful!”
Reviews.Author: Dabbydawg3
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor and the hotel were easy to work with to cancel 3 nights. This place has so much potential that it really made sad. The owner needs to sink some money into carpeting and remodeling (if not rebuilding). The water faucets spun freely and you either got hot or cold. Front desk clerk tried to offer other rooms or a repairman but there was such an overall feeling of distaste we just could not stay. The strong smell of Lysol was evident. But great location and front porch were to their benefit. Hopefully someone will give this place some deserved TLC. Maybe it was just the rooms in the lower levels that were so awful. Pics very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared”
Reviews.Author: jpelements
Reviews.Content: room & bathroom was waaay smaller than inside cabin/stateroom on cruise ship.....very worn hotel overall.....thank goodness the housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful.....no coffee maker in room....no microwave in room.....parking is a drag.....elevator tiny and S-L-O-W.... this place has potential with great location (directly on boardwalk & bewach) and should capitalize on that....use front porch for wine and apps everyday for guests at 5pm.....knock out a few walls and make rooms into suites....make certain shower stalls allow for bending over to shave legs!!!! HH, please don't sink to become just a place for highschool seniors to crash....

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rayandcassandra03
Reviews.Content: Ok I have to admit some of the reviews scared me before I stayed here, but after I stayed I realized a lot of the reviews were wrong. I checked the beds for bed bugs because someone said in a review they had bed bugs. This is not true. We had 2 rooms and both rooms were clean. The beds were clean no bugs at all. The staff was very nice and the swimming pool was like bath water. I loved the front porch. There was plenty of rocking chairs to sit in. It was very relaxing to sit in the rocking chairs and watch the sun come up. I do recommend this hotel. It was a great value for my money and the location was perfect. My car would not start the following day and when no one would help me including a police officer the manager of the hotel saved the day. They went and got a power pack and jumped my car for me. The saved me a lot of time and money. I will be back to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: gatortime11
Reviews.Content: I was on a 5 day vacation,when I got there I was able to get in to my room at 9am which was cool.And when I talked to the manager there about the bigger rooms that I seen open and avalible,she gave me a free upgrade to one of the bigger rooms because they were not avalible on line...I will be back

Reviews.Title: “THEY HAVE BEDBUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbaudia4
Reviews.Content: *****They have BEDBUGS!!!!!!***** I work for a pest control company and me and my fiance stayed there last thursday 5/12/11 checked into room 220 and being in the pest control industry I always check where I stay and found 2 bedbugs on my matress inseam. Went downstairs complained they put me in a different room, stayed the night when called that following monday to see if i could get my money back due to the inconvenience, the manager argued with me over phone that their pest control guy couldnt find any live activity when he checked, so I was in the wrong. Yet when I did find them she sent the house keeping manager to my room and she confirmed as well there were bed bugs in my room. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: Laquinda1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Harrison Hall with my son. This was the first time we had visited Ocean city Maryland. I must say that the staff was really friendly when I arrived. I was surprised when the staff says "Oh we upgraded you to a better room with the view of the beach". You would think oh okay this is nice. I was very surprised when I open the door to this very small room. I have never stayed in a room so small. Then the hot water oh my goodness. I called the front desk and they say "Oh you have to let it run for a while but if it doesnt get hot call us back and we will call maintaince." I would not pick this hotel again although the price was good they quality of the room is not worth the money. Bad experience especailly for my first time there. So what a surprise

Reviews.Title: “This place is all about the friendly Lobby, great front porch and awsome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Flamingo34
Reviews.Content: Harrison Hall is old. There are certain things you have to overlook that are unavoidable in an old hotel. The staff, atmosphere and front porch all make up for what you are missing in room size, style, and bathroom ammenities. The lobby is like a great big living room. PJs are the norm in the morning when everyone is getting their free coffee, hot coco, fruit, or heating up their breakfast in the microwave. Other hotel guests are more like neighbors. I go every Spring and every Fall and wouldn't miss my beach friends for anything. I consider the staff beach friend too because they are so friendly, they are like a big family. You see the same faces year after year and they become psrt of your vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a poophole!”
Reviews.Author: bsslegel
Reviews.Content: I'm actually quite surprised by any of the positive reviews of this dump! Maybe it's like playing Russian Roulette as far as what quality of room you get. I went with my wife and daughter based on the Hotel's website, which was very deceiving! The first room we got was on the ground floor and it was dirty and extremely small. We brought a pack & play for my daughter, but there was absolutely no floor space for it. There was barely enough room to walk sideways between the foot of the bed and the TV stand. The bathroom was foul and small. We only stayed there for a few minutes, since we asked to be given another room. The did accomodate us, but the room was only slightly larger and was still filthy. My daughter crawled on the floor once and her hands and knees were black. I don't think they ever vacuum the floors. On the positive side....the pool was nice and the front porch was a great place to relax...and they gave you a reason to stay out of the horrible room!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly better than camping”
Reviews.Author: cbdbtravel
Reviews.Content: On the negative side: The hotel is old and EVERYTHING needs updated (furniture, bedding, carpets, bathroom fixtures/flooring). Bathroom is VERY small and there is VERY little shelf space and only 1 towel bar and 0 hooks. There are NO refunds if you check out earlier than your reservation check out date. On the positive side: The staff members were responsive and the friendly housekeeping staff did the best they could with what they had to work with. The outdoor pool is nice/clean, and the location on 15th St./Boardwalk is good if you enjoy walking.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: LCA15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrison Hall this past summer. It was a horrible experience. The bathroom was the dirtiest bathroom I have seen staying at a hotel. We believe there to even be mold in one of the corners. The carpet in the room was dirty and gross. The room had a terrible smell. Overall the room/bathroom was completely out dated and not up-kept very well. We even had to leave a day early because of a family emergency (an expected death in family) and the manager Michelle was not understanding to work with us at all. Very disappointed in our stay. Definitely not going back again.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: oceanbust
Reviews.Content: it was nice, had a wonderful room, nice and spacious, The view was good, The only problem was the Saturday night very immature people stayed up the whole entire night and were very mean to the guest I keep telling my girls dont yell in the hallway etc well these people yelled all night long and yelled and screamed outside, I should of reported them right away, I actually had some arrogant biker tell me, oh stay on the other side, I was like No..tell them to shut the hell up.. but it what I get for ignorant bikers... knowone we have such a bad reputation... Next time Ill call 911...

Reviews.Title: “"do not waste your money"”
Reviews.Author: TripHelp2
Reviews.Content: This hotels website is very decieving, from the pictures it looked like a decent nice place, however when we got there we were put in a room that the door barely opened without smashing off the fridge that was put in the closet, not to mention there were 4 of us and they put us in a room that only fits 3 and was about the size of a closet , 4 people could not even walk around, it was very dirty and smelled of mold . The bathroom was horrendous. I didn't even unpack my suitcase due to bed bugs. Not to mention when we went to the staff and asked about upgrading to a new room they were rude and refused to put us in a new room, they were not helpful or friendly at all ! Needless to say we checked out and went to a new hotel the next day. The ONLY ADVANTAGE of this dump is the pool and its location, other then that the place is gross smelly and a waste of your money !

Reviews.Title: “I spent a week in Harrison hall hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ronmitch
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Harrison hall hotel, and I loved it. The staff was friendly, and helpful. Honey, our maid was great, and Vicky ran a tight ship. Every question she was asked she knew the answered. The hotel, pool, and front was always clean. I loved being able to walk out the front door and being on the boardwalk. My lady and I had a great time. We will surely stay there again Ronald Mitchell

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronda02
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Ocean City, MD one weekend every summer for the last five summers. I was recommended to the Harrison Hotel by Victoria Collick. She promised I'd get A-1 service and I did. I was able to access the beach, boardwalk and restaurant without moving my car. I will definitely use this hotel again next year and I have told all my family and friends that this was the best hotel I've ever stayed in at Ocean City. I'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: tray112
Reviews.Content: I must admit I waited until the last minute to book our weekend and I was expecting the price to be through the roof especially since the hotel is right on the boardwalk. Everything was great from check in to check out. Check in was quick and my room was ready before check in time which really pleased me. The pool was clean and not over crowded, the pool bar prices were reasonable. My room was the perfect size. Housekeeping supplied us with more than enough towels and face clothes which was a plus, because we showered several times a day. I loved sitting in those huge rocking chairs that over looked the beach/boardwalk. Will definitely be returning next summer !

Reviews.Title: “all i can say is thank god for my suitcase full of beer......!”
Reviews.Author: misswhitney00
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, the harrison hall turned out to be just what i expected.. small, old and run down. but since my boyfriend and i were on a budget and just looking for a cheap place to sleep and shower on the boardwalk, this seemed to be the best buy. our room was super small with carpet that wasn't even installed.. just thrown on the floor and going up the wall.. our fridge didn't keep our food cold.. the shower had horrible water pressure and was mildew stained. the girls at the front desk were about the most unpleasant people i've ever had to deal with.. but i can say the room service was very good! they always had clean towels for us and emptied out our garbage. the pool was definitely the best part of the hotel.. very big and the tiki bar was a plus too! i wouldn't want to stay at the harrison hall again, but if you're looking for a cheap place to crash at a great location and don't plan on spending a whole lot of time in your room, this place will work. i can say that if it wouldn't have been for my suitcase full of beer i probably would have been really bothered by our uncomfortably small dirty room! :)

Reviews.Title: “We knew what we were in for...”
Reviews.Author: mdgeorge
Reviews.Content: We read the other reviews but gave it a shot anyway. If you're pressed for cash, you'll save by staying at Harrision Hall and the location is great, but... our room was tiny and dark and moldy smelling. The hotel restaurant (DaVinci's) was horrible -- food wasn't very good and was cold. When it came back cold a second time, the waiter said "well it's not my fault, it's the people in the kitchen". But hey, there are plenty of other places to eat at OC. Next time, we'll either put out a bit more cash for something nicer or stay more North of OC.

Reviews.Title: “We wore flip flops in the room our whole stay!”
Reviews.Author: lamartinwv
Reviews.Content: The location is about the only good thing I have to say about our accommodations. The shower had an uncapped hole in the wall for ventilation and there was no soap in the shower. Called downstairs to get some only to get a suggestion to go to the CVS on 17th instead. They eventually covered the hole and brought up two small bars of soap and 4 tiny bottles of shampoo. I wouldn't say they clean the best either. My friend and I wore our flip flops in the room the whole time to avoid putting our feet anywhere near the floor. This would a good place for students but not adults/families.

Reviews.Title: “Eh- Could have done better”
Reviews.Author: AudreyCash
Reviews.Content: The room was okay. I wouldn't go anything above okay. The hotel caught my attention because it was 1 1/2 miles from the start of the boardwalk and right on the boardwalk. It was orginally only a place to sleep for the night, check out and go to the beach then travel back to DC. (ended up staying another night in the Hilton up the street) The staff was friendly. the building really is old- old for some reason equals NO water pressure. The showers are very small, and the rooms are dark (had a side facing room). I only paid 150 for the night, so I thought it was reasonable. that price for peak season on the boardwalk... however I would pay a little bit more and bit in a nice new hotel. To there credit, the hotel and room was clean. The carpet was old, but clean at the least.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Harrison Hall...”
Reviews.Author: Debbiem_10
Reviews.Content: The elevator is so dirty, floor dirty, If you stay, book only ocean front rooms. The porch is the only nice thing about this hotel. For a few dollars more, stay at the Quality Inn on 17th Street .

Reviews.Title: “Love Harrison Hall for 4 seasons returning 2010 for 3 visits!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLuvr1960
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed to the Harrison Hall for 4 seasons. I stay 3 separate times every year = a dozen visits! One week with family in the summer; long weekend early Sept., and several nights in October. I was recommended to hotel by a friend who's been going to HH for over a decade. Positive: Location, location, location.... on the beach & boardwalk watching from nostalgic wooden rocking chairs. Staff does the best they can which works for me. Other guest are @ hotel to enjoy the ocean & get away from home for a stay. Pool is fine w/ tiki bar right there. Fantastic Italian restaurant in basement. Tram car rides to main part of boardwalk (for a fee of course). Negative: Nostalgic = old. Showers are interesting to figure out. Dated, run down in some rooms = walls dirty in some rooms, tile floor coming apart in some bathrooms, the size room you get is what you pay for (that's life). We've always paid the most & have been pleased. The beds are UNCOMFORTABLE in everyroom but we pack an eggcrate to compensate. I consider Comfort Inn camping & this beats any Comfort Inn by far because of location & staff who I say truly Cares. Mrs. B from Pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjd4343
Reviews.Content: I was a little afraid to stay here from some of the previous reviews but was happy with our stay. The front desk staff are extremely nice and helpful!! The rooms were small but clean and the beds were clean and comfortable, and you can't beat the location! It was also a very quiet hotel, even during senior week time.. whih was nice since we were traveling with 2 toddlers. The only negative things I can think of is the bathroom, it was extremely small, and the elevators were down a lot (but the maintenence staff did work very hard to fix them as soon as they went down and many staff members offered to help carry beach gear for us down the stairs from the 5th floor which we were staying on, which was a very nice gesture!) Overall we throughly enjoyed our vacation and would return to this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel doesn't deserve all the negative criticism.”
Reviews.Author: SJSOhio
Reviews.Content: From a past trip to Ocean City and seeing the lovely porch with the big wooden rockers, I wanted to stay at Harrison Hall. The reviews almost made me think twice about that, but we decided to give it a try for one night. The hotel was old, but the room was comfortable............on the small side, but clean and comfortable. The pool was wonderful. Ironically though, don't let those lovely looking rockers fool you. They don't rock.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: skywalker2of5
Reviews.Content: We came for our niece's senior week, and stayed because we liked it. Didn't see the kids all weekend. The rooms and showers are small, but they were very clean. The hotel has charm of the past, has been completely remodeled so everything is new. The nicest amenity is the porch and large lobby area overlooking the ocean that everyone can enjoy. The hotel staff are excellent and well informed about local events.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean front only!!”
Reviews.Author: jf49
Reviews.Content: Pay a little more, get a nicer room with a nice view. Small, yes! Clean and comfortable, OK! Want luxury, go somewhere else. The porch and location sells this hotel. We had an oceanfront room on the second floor, and enjoyed it. Our son and his wife saved $15 and got a side room. What a difference!! Noisey and NO view. They spent more time in our room than we did!! Nice ocean breeze, never ran the AC.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS”
Reviews.Author: Zacur
Reviews.Content: It was extremely gross our room sheets were not clean n it smelled horrible. Good for senior week but beside that it's a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “The Harrison Hall is Not as bad as you would think.”
Reviews.Author: kchaps18
Reviews.Content: Yes the pictures are outdated. And yes, the rooms were very very small. But my boyfriend and i stayed there while on vacation and you couldnt have a better location. Our room was very small but we didnt stay in that a lot , we walked out the from door on to the boardwalk and it was wonderful to see the ocean at night. We did have a slight bug problem in our room but the Young man who came down and helped was HILARIOUS and it made out stay even more funny. Take everything with a grain of salt people. if you want a fantastic, new, fancy hotel- then go pay the 200 for it . if you are a poor young couple like ourselves and want a 50 dollar room on the boardwalk then take your own blankets to sleep on and expect what you are going to get ...if the people there were rude- id tell you not to stay there... but they were helpful and i fee like i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “didnt really like the hotel....it didnt stop the fun.”
Reviews.Author: MsAdkins010
Reviews.Content: Well the location is great right on the boardwalk..the hotel was old, not to clean...it was hair in the tub. The bathroom didnt smell to clean, bed sheets didnt feel clean we sprayed febrezze all over the room before unpacking.The soda and snack machine is in the basement....We had a hard time getting hot water in the shower my husband was so mad..lol...But we really enjoyed ourself.. the kids had a great time in the pool out back...We seen great fire works on 4th of july...right in front of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “ok!!!”
Reviews.Author: oceanbust
Reviews.Content: Well great place....good location for bikers Delmarva weekend....Not enough places open to eat though closed for the season.... but place was ok. Needs housekeeping...needs much repair...I did the two days of cleaning. I gave her $2.00 tip I had to vaccuumm...two days take the dirty towels down the shoot and got rid of the trash and got the toilet paper ...Our maid stunk....if your going to have people come back take care of the maids.. The last day when half of the place is checking out tell the maids to wait.... I mean the hallways are small and people have so much stuff trash lying all over the floor gorss for your luggage to walk all over...the piles of laundry all over the hallway....if check out is 11:00 a.m. and the new pople arent coming until 3:00 tell them to wait our pick up the trash why have it all over the carpet....looks like they dont care about the owners of the place escpailly carpet what if you see a sanitary something I mean.....take the time and tell the maids...to pick it up......... I will come back...but will review again......and look at the reviews.. room 318/needs new screens they cost much....Charge everyone a service fee for a t.. remote everyone needs a remote.....if its stolen they dont get it back....tell the people they can return it for their money back. take care of our needs....

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Gross Mold”
Reviews.Author: OurVacation09
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights for the very first time. Like everyone else has said, if you're looking for a 5 star hotel this is NOT the place for you. You get what you pay for but I did have one MAJOR concern. There was very visible mold speckled all over the ceiling of the bathroom which I can only assume is because there is no exhaust or fan. When we addressed management about the problem they said they didn't have any rooms close to the size we had. We had 2 beds that they claim were queens... They appeared to be smaller than queens. According to management this was one of the largest rooms in the place. They offered to have maintenance come in and "clean the mold". Clearly that was a pacifier to shut us up because that kind of mold can't just be wiped up. We were given a credit for half of the second night we stayed after we further complained. The room was old, but appeared to be clean for what it was. There was a small refrigerator in the room inside of what looks like used to be a closet with no door. The small chair in the room by the window was old and coming apart at the seams. The mattresses were old and like other reviews stated, had huge dips in the middle. The water pressure sucked and it took me literally 5 minutes to get the proper temperature to shower. I was unable to shower my toddler the second night because I simply couldn't get a temperature that wasn't either ice cold or hot enough to melt off your skin. The elevator wasn't totally horrible but was a little rough and VERY small. I saw a couple people cram the baggage carts in them which I thought would be impossible, but it did take forever for them to get in and out of the elevator with them. On a brighter note... The pool is great and very clean. The lobby is nice and the rockers on the large porch right on the boardwalk are super relaxing. If it weren't for the mold, I would say I would stay again because of the price and location... Just concerns me because I know that breathing that in can't be healthy. I would recommend this place ONLY if the mold problem would be taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: robsangel1006
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews for this hotel and kind of had my doubts but booked here anyway. I AM GLAD I DID. We had a oceanfront room and it was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Granted the bathroom was tiny but clean. Who spends alot of time in their room anyway? The front porch was my favorite....I was out there morning and night...the sunrise is AMAZING!! My teenagers loved the pool and being right on the boardwalk. I can't wait to go back and my husband and kids are already making plans. The only thing I can say is if you are expecting the Ritz don't book here cause all you will do is complain... but if you want a nice family oriented hotel this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “a cozy classic.”
Reviews.Author: gabbogurl
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about staying in this hotel after reading all the reviews posted. However my stay there was actually great! My only complaint along with my fiances is that the shower head maybe needed a good cleaning, and the elevator needs to be fixed. it also would have been nice to have our own coffee or microwave, but we didnt go to the beach for that stuff! the lobby had all those amenties so it worked out! Besides all that It was at a really great location. The beach was right there in front of the hotel, and it was at a great place boardwalk wise, because it wasnt in the crazy busy part, and to get to where all the shops and such were you only had to walk a little ways! the porch was great to sit on early in the morning and late at night. The staff was nice, when we sighned in they said our room wasnt ready but after a few minutes they had another room ready and it was perfect! The AC in our room worked great! the beds were comfy and so were the pillows. It really had a home feel to it with everyone chatting in the lobby and on the porch. The important thing to realize prior to booking a room in the hotel is that the place is old. It wasn't built 5 or even 10 years ago. it was built around the 1950's and so it is very old, but simple. and if you like simple, and old things then this is a good place to stay. I dont care what anyone else says about the hotel, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “was expecting a lot worse”
Reviews.Author: beachbumbaby09
Reviews.Content: we were here 8/10/09-8/14/09..we had the 1st rm off the lobby w/2 queen beds & a lot more room than i was expecting..we were celebrating our daughters 1st bday at the ocean, the floor was very dirty-every time she crawled on it her feet turned instant black. & it is not handicapped accessible-no ramps to get in the front, the 1 handicapped entrance locks at 11pm, we ended up carrying our stroller up the porch each time.the elevator deffinately shows it's age,i don't know how people were getting the luggage carts inside, i think it's just the same size as 1,needless to say we didn't use a cart,the bathroom was a good size, full sized tub/shower, the controls for the water were very odd & took a long time to get the water temp right, there was horrible mold outside the tub w/floor pealing back. you could tell they don't clean the rooms well at all.. it seemed like they just remade the beds, we found a shoe that wasn't ours at the bed edge..we've stayed at the oceanic-another harrison group hotel, and that was a lot worse then this was. being that we aren't in the room that long, i could deal with it. it is a great location..very easy beach access..i think they need to update a lot of things here in the off season. i actually had a lot of people peeking into or room when we had the door open to see the size-they all said it was big.. if you know what to expect & not expecting a name group hotel, this isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN WILL WE STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: moms2kidz
Reviews.Content: We went on our first family vacation, sure it was only 4days but with a 17mth old and 7 mth we will never stay at this hotel again. Our first room the shower only had cold water so they changed us to another room. The beds smelled, and the entire room had a musky odor to it. Sure the porch and the location is great but the elevator was slow and the rooms were dirty. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Never, Never Again. Gross place and the staff sucks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: warrenVa
Reviews.Content: You know is disgusting when you have to clean your room upon arriving. When you ask the staff for something, they look at you like your retarded. I had to sweep the bathroom and vacuum the room. It all started when I found a spermicide wrapper under the bed. Oh and when you ask for towels and wash clothes you don't recieve them. No coffee in the morning and the nasty fruit runs out before you know it!! Oh yea, the bathroom floor had hair all over it and cobb webs. The halls had odors ranging from fish to toilets. Very, Very poor, and NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: stommi68
Reviews.Content: When we first got to the hotel the outside pool and the building itself looked nice.. that's about all I can say good about our stay. The elevator barely works.. the hallways are extremely dirty and crowded.. and our room was disgusting. The room stunk, the AC was broke, the floors needed to be vacuumed, and there was hair all in the bathroom. When we asked if someone could clean our bathroom while we were out, the lady we asked said that wasn't her job and walked away. I guess someone did finally clean our room after asking 3 people who said they couldn't help us. We would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, not in a million years!”
Reviews.Author: dorchester314
Reviews.Content: This hotel was supposed to be a "step-up" from the first hotel that we had reservations at that we very quickly found a way to get out of. Although the staff has been very friendly and very quick to respond to requests, the hotel itself is in utterly terrible condition. The room we were given was a king room on the 4th floor. The room is so small that two people can barely walk by each other. There were only three outlets in this room. One was behind the bed (couldn't reach it), the other was for othe tv and the light (no available slots there) and the other was in the closet behind the refrigerator. The bed itself leaned to one side and the they did not supply a blanket so you were left with using the nasty bedspread to provide warmth. The A/C needed to be on all the time to help keep out the humidity. Now on to the bathroom. There are no words to adequately describe how bad this bathroom was. We actually went out and bought a bottle of bleach to dump into the shower which was so small that the smallest of little people would have felt cramped. Even after dumping bleach in the shower we still showered with our flipflops on. Heaven forbid if you would drop something while in the shower. You would either fall out of the stall or bang your head as you bent over. The shower curtain was so long that it hung three inches on the floor collecting all kinds of mold and mildew. The water pressure... well there wasn't any water pressure and the water temperature ranged from ice cold to scalding hot. There was no place within the shower to place your shampoo/conditioner/soap products. The knob that turned on the shower was so caked with mold and mildew you didn't really want to touch it. The flooring was peeling and coming up. The toilet would only flush properly if you stood there and held the handle for a good 90 seconds. There is no exhaust fan so you have to shower with the door open. You couldn't change clothes in the bathroom without banging your knees on something because the space was so incredibly small. Don't take your shoes off in the room because the carpet is so dirty looking and appears to have not been cleaned in a really long time. They provided no plastic bag for the ice bucket so you were expected to put your ice in a bucket that could have had who knows what dumped in it previsously. Be extremely careful if you get on the elevator. It will take you for quite a ride. Make sure you don't have a weak stomach because you will get jerked all over the place as it starts and stops. Don't plan on easily getting yourself and the luggage cart in it either. It's an incredibly tight fit. This hotel isn't handicap friendly either. The last complaint deals with parking. Good luck getting a space. There is definitely not enough spaces for the number of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever Again!!”
Reviews.Author: almoney0506
Reviews.Content: My sister in law chose this hotel when we decided to spend a few days at the beach with our 16 month old children. It mostly appealled to us because of the affordable price and location on the boardwalk. I came to trip advisor to read the ratings after we booked our rooms and was horrified. We decided to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and brave it. WHAT A HUGE MISTAKE!! My family doesn't expect anything near luxury, but we do expect bathrooms without mold, showers without ants, floors without exposed nails, and elevators to work. This place is rediculous. One morning, the toilet in our room clogged, so I asked if someone could come take care of it. Three hours later, the toilet was still clogged. I had to take it upon myself to "steal" a plunger out of the neighboring maid's closet and fix the toilet myself. Please trust me when I say, "Do not stay at this hotel. Spend the extra hundred or two to stay somewhere that cares about their visitors."

Reviews.Title: “Great For a Cheap Getaway Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: newb85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harrison Hall Hotel for the Fourth of July weekend with a group of friends. I found the rooms & beds to be small yet comfortable, but the bathroom did leave something to be desired. Showering without the curtain open was nearly impossible as there is barely enough room to turn around. This wouldn't be such a problem if it weren't for the water fluctuating from cold to scalding every time someone else in the hotel flushes a toilet or turns on the water. (Note that there are rooms that have updated bathrooms--ours just wasn't one of them.) All in all, definitely recommended for a group of college-aged or young 20-somethings that are looking for a cheap place to crash after bar hopping. It's right on the boardwalk--just a drunken stumble away from most area bars. We had two rooms and the staff didn't seem to want to ask any questions as to why we only had one double & one single bed but five people walking into each room..... As for the other reviews on here--we were on the third floor and didn't encounter any bugs, and yes, the elevator is terrifying. We used it once and didn't get back on after it shut on my friend's suitcase. All in all, recommended for a cheap stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: wvufballfans
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Harrison and yes i would stay there again matter of fact this was my second stay there. First we arrived early that day around 9 am and check in isnt until 3 but we got our room at 915 am. Cant say thats bad service.As for the room it was room 420 yes it was small but then again it is one of the original hotels in o.c. but how much time do you spend there any way. Our room was very clean other than the sand that was embeeded into the carpet but then again it is a oceanfront hotel. i didnt see the need in any lysol or candels as the room smelled fine. other than the typical beach smell all rooms near the beach have. as for the bathroom a tad small but was fine for one person our room had a bathtub. and as far as the water pressure. if some would just take the time to read some of the info that is left in the room they would see that the water pressue isnt anything that they can control. in the lobby they did offer free internet if you could get the teenagers off of it. yes we made the mistake of going down during senior week wont happen again. the staff was very friendly always asking you if there was anything you needed. cleaning ladies always coming around to clean the rooms if you wanted them to. my only complaint was the baby pool it wasnt holding water. but they where trying to address the issue before we left to come home my littlest one didnt seem to mind she just got in the big pool which by the way was cleaned daily. did notice one new improvement since the last time i was there is that they added a shower around by the pool so you could wash off before going to the pool or inside.all in all had a very good time there other the weather not being the greatest but hey the harrison cant control that. but then again there is probably some people that stayed there would disagree. so if you are looking a good cheap place to stay on the boardwalk that is close to everything yet not right in the middle of it all then stay there i will again sometime. they also offer customer loyalty pricing at the end of sept -oct for the price of either 10 or 15 dollars per person is the big chain hotels in oc going to do that probably not !!!!!!!!! if you dont need all the frills that the big hotels give you at a much higher price than stay here

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & dirty”
Reviews.Author: Leonje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Harrison Hall because of the really cheap price and the fact that it was on the boardwalk. If it weren't so cheap, I probably wouldn't stay there again. We actually got a bigger room than we had reserved. The room was still small, but it had a double and a twin bed inside. The bathroom was awful. The shower was very small and seems to have been created or repaired by an amateur. The room also had a weird smell to it. It didn't seem to be thouroughly cleaned as we found a bunch of smashed crackers under one bed. However, we didn't go to Ocean City to sit around in a hotel room. The location was great and we spent most of our time walking the boardwalk and going to the beach. There are tons of restaurants and shops nearby - we didn't have to use our car at all. We had no problems with the hotel staff. Check in was easy and we always had plenty of towels in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: Chevygirl35
Reviews.Content: I was scared when I first booked this place after reading the reviews, so I packed the Lysol and a candle. When I got there I found it not to be as bad as what it was made out on some of the other reviews. It wasn't the Hilton, but it was comparable to other hotels in OCMD I've stayed at in the past for the money spent. It wasn't the cleanest place I've ever stayed in, but it wasn't bad. For all the longer we were in the room, it was acceptable. The hot water in the shower was a bit questionable at times and there wasn't much space to turn around, but again - this isn't an overly expensive place. The staff was nice and the housekeeping gave us whatever we asked for. The wireless internet in the lobby was a nice feature. Location was a big plus and so was the roomy porch with the rocking chairs. We will definitely see about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Total dump!!”
Reviews.Author: catchrays
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in alot of places in O.C. and this was by far the worst! Hotel is very old and needs major renovations! Room itself was smelly and dirty. Stayed for 3 nights and could not bring myself to use the shower. Disgusting! Had mold and mildew in it and my friend who used it said the water didn't drain and you had to stand in 2 inches of water as you took your shower! There were holes/damages to walls throughout the hotel. Overall, a dump! The only things right about this place was the price and the location!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmhlancaster
Reviews.Content: This place has a lot to be desired. When we first walked in the door, I had a really bad feeling. It only got worse when we got to our room. It was extremely small, smelled like mildew, was dirty with holes in the walls. The water in the bathroom sink was running, we couldn't get it to stop. I slept with my shoes on because I didn't want to get out of bed and touch the floor. I was extremely uncomfortable sleeping as I was so nervous a bug would crawl across me or something. I will never stay at this place again. Of course it looks nice from the outside, very appealing, but don't think twice about booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “It's old, needs updating, but it's not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: Sterling123
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Harrison Hall about 4 times now, the last time in June of '08. We've encountered some problems, but I was willing to deal with them rather than pay double or triple to be somewhere more upscale. You're still right on the beach (get the oceanfront rooms!) and you have the front porch with the rocking chairs-- this is why we come here. Plus the outdoor pool is quite nice, something that many lower-cost hotels can't say. We also like Davinci's, a pretty good Italian restaurant right on site. The worst problems we've had have been the teeny size of the smaller rooms, and the hot water / cold water issue. We always get the oceanfront king bed rooms now. This last trip, the shower worked fine. It is a tiny bathroom and one-person only shower, for sure. The elevator can be tempermental-- they're old but they generally work. They could pay more attention to detail like cleaning hallway windows and updating the old furniture. But we're saving well over $100 a night to stay here-- mainly, sleep here. We love to open the windows and sleep to the sound of the ocean. This last trip, we had to ask if the windows could be cleaned-- saltwater haze distorted the ocean view. Some of the new wallpaper was peeling a bit in the "recently renovated" bathroom. Still pretty old looking. We also had to push hard to get the entry door open because it stuck pretty good. There was also trash bags in the narrow hallway for almost two days. This is as bad as the problems have ever gotten here for us. Maybe booking early gets us the better rooms. We still consider HH to be a great value for the money. Not everyone wants to pay $250-$300 per night. It's more of a dorm or cabin experience, but it doesn't deserve to be trashed like many reviewers have. Another good reason to stay here is this-- something I've never heard of before: If you stay at HH between memorial and labor day, you get to return after labor day for $10 a night. It's their guest appreciation policy. September is more than warm enough to take advantage of that. This year will be our first guest appreciation stay-- so I'm hoping we don't find anything worse than what we experienced in the past. We've never had stained linens-- that's the one thing I keep reading that's starting to worry me.

Reviews.Title: “I would have rather driven home, than stay there. Dirty, damaged rooms”
Reviews.Author: OCLoverMaryland
Reviews.Content: Oh, my! When we looked at the pictures on the website, they were charming. Not so. The lobby looked so cheesy. We checked in, went upstairs the narrow hallway. When I tried to close the bathroom door, I noticed it was dragging along the tile floor. Then I looked up. The screws on the hinge were pulled out of the door. The door wasn't even fastened. The wallpaper was falling off the bathroom door, and the upholstered furniture was torn. The view was of the ceiling of another part of the building. We went right downstairs and demanded a refund. Beware = there is a sign in the lobby saying no refunds. I told them I booked a room that was in nice condition - liveable. They gave me a room at the Holiday Inn on 17th st. They are affiliated with it, so at least we didn't have to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: 814mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in August. Some of the reviews had merit but I feel you get what you pay for. I cannot say enough about the staff and how helpful they were. Our party used three rooms and ranged in age from 3 to 77. We enjoyed the porch and lobby very much and the closeness of the beach and boardwalk was a big plus. When I had to take my mother to the ER before checkout on Saturday, the staff was very concerned and helpful. The beds were comfortable and clean. My only complaint would be the COLD shower!!!! I am returning in October with my fiance for a long customer appreciation weekend.

Reviews.Title: “To call this a 'fleabag' hotel would be an unconscionable insult to fleas!”
Reviews.Author: maam724
