Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Harrison, I immediately knew by the nasty smell that welcomed us that we were going to be in for a real treat. The first room we stayed in (for 30 minutes) had such a terrible plumbing problem; we had to move to another room. The second room we got was just as dirty and smelly as the first. There was this huge mysterious stain on one of the beds that my friend had pointed out. Then, I grabbed a washcloth to wash my face and there was a fresh yellow stain on it. It was used and it looked like someone wiped their dirty butt with it. I was livid. I tried to take a shower but it was almost impossible because there was no water pressure. Not to mention that the bathroom in a prison is much bigger and cleaner. Needless to say, I kept my flip flops on in the shower and during our entire stay. I was really fuming over my shower experience. So, my friend and I went to the front desk with dirty cloth in hand and a picture that we took of the mattress. He refunded us part of our money back, but I wanted to leave and unfortunately, my friend wanted to stay. We were now moved to our third room thinking that we could get a better shower in there but I was wrong. No water pressure. You either take a cold shower or a scolding hot shower. See the hotter you make the water, the more pressure you get. Shower at your own risk. Oh, and don’t even get me started on the elevators! They jump and bounce and never dropped us off on the fifth floor. We had to get off on the 4th floor and walk up to the fifth. One of the attendants at the hotel assured us that the elevator was in tip top shape. One afternoon when we returned from the beach we were greeted by a pair of men’s shoes in our wastebasket. Then, my friend brought her heirloom beach blanket for her son to lay on at the beach and when she set it in front of our door to dry because we had to no room in our 4 x 4 room, we realized that someone decided to urinate on the blanket and someone threw pizza boxes on it. I was so disgusted and my friend had to part with the blanket that was in her family for years. I felt like I couldn’t touch anything or walk barefooted for fear of contacting a disease. We slept on our beach towels because the sheets and pillowcases were stained and had not been washed from the previous guest because loose hairs from another person were all over it. This place is so old, smelly and dingy, it needs to be bulldozed.

Reviews.Title: “You work hard for your money, Don't waste it here!”
Reviews.Author: JENNY1235
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying, yes Harrison Hall is convenient, Yes, It sits right on the boardwalk, but that is all. For the last several years my fiancée and I have overlooked the lack of cleanliness for the convenience; however our past visit was our last visit. Aside from the dirt on the walls, the stains on the ceiling, and the fear of sleeping on the bed due to lack of changing the bedding, I have to say the customer service aspect of Harrison Hall is by far the worst that I have ever experienced. As an employee of company whose main focus is on the guest relations I have to say that I would be ashamed to work at a Harrison Hall. When we arrived we braced ourselves as we have in the past by saying” It’s just a place to sleep.” After check in we made our way to our designated room on the third floor which was a “king size bed” (which we paid for upon check in) and my fiancée and I both agreed that we wanted something on the first floor in case of emergencies (any other floor besides the first there is only one way out in case of emergencies.) Before even bringing in our luggage we went back down to the main lobby to ask if something was available on the first floor. Sure enough their was, we were placed in the same room as we were the year before room 116 a ”queen bed” not worried about price change only our safety we at this point finally made our way to our room. Much to what we expected it was a room much smaller than on the third floor, a room that only had a queen bed, when in fact we paid for a king, and a room with dirty floors. At this point we were both in disgust that we sucked it up four days making sure never to be bare foot, and never to sleep on the bed without our own blanket beneath us. To me this isn’t what a vacation should be... it was very uncomfortable having to continuously worry. However we made it through and for the most part overlooked a lot of things. At first we weren’t going to question the price change (from a king bed, down to a queen bed) but because of our unpleasant experience we decided to. On the day of our departure we went to the main lobby again, and asked if we can be reimbursement for the smaller room that we were moved into (We only asked for a room change to the first floor not a smaller room.). The women at the front desk checked something on the computer and then left to ask a manager what she should do, when she came back with an answer for us she said: “We moved you to the first floor, because the room on the third floor wasn’t ready when you checked in.” Cleary she was not stating the truth, when in fact we asked for the change. She was stunned to find out that we asked for the moved, at this point the Manager came behind the desk already defensive, and stated “ They were both King size beds, you can measure them if you want, prices do change, and we move beds around.” So my question is… Which is the real story… first you tell us that you changed our rooms, when in reality we had asked for the change, or was it that the rooms were both king size and you change the rooms around.. At this point it wasn’t about getting a reimbursement back, it was based on principal, the management lied to us…. We left not knowing the truth, and will never come back to find it out. Customer Service, Cleanliness, and Safety are obliviously not Harrison Halls main focus. If you are only looking for convenience then this is the place for you. If you are looking for everything else do not waste you’re hard earn money.

Reviews.Title: “old and stinks”
Reviews.Author: teddy2maryland
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on the internet and the web site for this hotel looked very nice and said it was remodeled.When we checked in the lobby was nice,then we got to the elevator which was dirty and smelled.When we got off on our floor the smell of old musty feet hit you in the face.When we got to the room it was small,paint was peeling around the windows,wall paper was peeling,the t.v. was 25 years old,furniture was chipped and peeling and the bathroom was so small you had to turn side ways to get to the toilet.Then later on that night I went to take a shower and only a small trickle would come out.I then had to wash my hair out in the tiny sink and finish bathing in the sink.Dont stay in this hotel if you like cleanliness,showers and modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: sara1975
Reviews.Content: Delmar, DE First off this is not the hilton or trump towers If your looking for the hilton but want to pay budget money for it-this place is not for you. If your looking for a great location on the beach with a large pool, you hit the jackpot. Me and my husband stayed here in july and for the price compared to other properties i didn't think it was bad. However, we are not individuals that like to go on vacation and hang out in our room most of the time. Granted the rooms are very small- but from my understanding this property is older and built when rooms didn't need to be spacious like todays standards. There is no luxury bathroom or larger than life bedroom- it has what it needs to have a room, a bed and a bathroom. Its cozy though and the porch in front of the lobby has these neat large rockers where you can hang out and enjoy watching the sunset or curl up and read a good book, play board games, enjoy a bite to eat or just relax while feeling the ocean breeze. You are literally just steps away from the boardwalk and the beach-which is awesome!!! You don't have to hike it in the hot sun and humidity across traffic to get back to your hotel before getting ready for a night out on the town. The olympic sized pool also has a tiki bar-very cool!! The staff was very nice and the rooms were clean, what more do you want for the price???

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: nurse2be09
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked our room at another hotel (Oceanic). After finding out that we got a smoking room instead of non-smoking and so on... we walked the boardwalk to find a new hotel. Our friends stayed at the Harrison Hall previous years, and we were debating which to stay in the first place. It really isn't as bad as some of the reviews are saying. Granite- it's not the Hilton, but it was do-able considering we only ate, showered, and slept there. Yes, the shower pressure isn't the greatest. Oh & the water did flucuate some, but that's everywhere when God knows how many people are showering. The tiolet took forever to finish it's thing. The room we got was SMALL. I mean small... enough for a bed & dresser. (Bed very uncomfy, but my husband & I have a Simmons BeautyRest so anything to us is uncomfy) The place is a bit outdated. The pictures online are not what you are getting so don't go by those. Staff is very very very helpful. That was the best part. Hallways are a tad bit narrow, and the elevator isn't very reliable. All in all... it's cheap, a good location, and do-able for a family on a fixed budget. You get what you pay for. Give it a try... if you don't like it, don't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful. Don't be fooled by the pretty pictures!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioRubberDucky
Reviews.Content: There were so many things wrong with the Harrison Hall Hotel that I'm not sure I can list them all. First off, we were promised an ocean view room and the only view we had was of the parking lot. The room and the hallway leading to the room was very dirty. We walked into our room, took one look around and walked right out. The rooms were not just old and outdated but unclean and smelly. We went downstairs, checked out and left. The staff was rude and not all accommodating. We did not receive any type of refund or even a question as to why we were leaving so soon. We paid over $160 for 2 minutes of our time. Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but watch out for the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: sream
Reviews.Content: I went a few days with my five year old son. The room was perfect with the exception of the bathroom. The bathroom looks like it was designed from the 40's. The toilet handle you had to hold down until it flushed. The shower, it took me 15 minutes to wash out the soap in my hair. The water came out that slow it was crazy. My five year was taking a shower and I had the hot water all the way on and the cold barley on and they water kept getting hot, cold. I decided to take our showers in the late afternoon hoping that would help but did not. The sink was disguisting and needs to be replaced in a bad way. The whole bathroom needs replaced. Over all the room was clean and perfect for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad !!”
Reviews.Author: acapps
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Harrison Hall for one week. Besides the fact that the water pressure in the shower was terrible, my stay was rather pleasant. the porch is great, and the staff was rather nice. I have read all the reviews, and I think that some of the reviews were a little harsh. This isnt the Hilton, so dont expect five star accomodations. For the money, you cant beat it. I will be staying there again this year, so how bad can it be?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Lots of Problems.”
Reviews.Author: bmoregirl
Reviews.Content: We had so many problems during our stay. Air conditioner stopped working, light burned out, and the shower broke. The location is excellent, and the rooms small. If you get a room that everything works consider yourself lucky. As long as you are not staying in the room for long periods of time, it's a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: collegegirl10
Reviews.Content: I stayed there the other night with a friend of mine. We're college students and we needed someplace cheap but nice! We found that the service was pretty good; the bathroom door wouldn't totally shut and the bathroom in general was a bit sketchy, but seemed moderately clean. The rest of the room was clean and it was good enough for the night. We loved the great lounge they have where you can sit and drink free coffee and look at the water and the great porch with huge rocking chairs :) We didn't go into the pool, since we were so busy at the beach but we did check it out, and there was a corner bar with music at the pool which seemed pretty nice to me! We had a great experience; its a great location (with the exception of the construction) and that part of the beach isn't very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brv5004
Reviews.Content: It didn't seem too bad of a hotel until we saw two or three cockroaches running across out floor!! I went to the front desk to ask for a refund of money and they said they don't have a cockroach problem "It must be a water bug"...well I wasn't born yesterday and I know exactly what a cockroach is and it WAS NOT a water bug. Anyways, We got no room upgrade or refund. I recommend NOT staying here and paying an extra twenty or so bucks a night to avoid huge cockroaches crawling on you in the middle of the night. YUK

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: fantaz77
Reviews.Content: They charged me 3 times for staying here! I contacted them and they act like they have no idea what I am talking about. The issue still has yet to be resolved. There are so many hotels and even if you are not on the water they are close. I loved Maryland, but i would never ever stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience and Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: lrwier
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of the hotel's "Getaway Package" which included a 3 day/2 night stay with breakfast or lunch and dinner at several selected restaurants of your choice and they offered an attractive price of $220 so I did not hesitate and made a same day reservation arriving that day. Overall, I was very satisfied with my experience and did not experience the problems that other users had experienced. The hallways were narrow and the rooms were smaller than what I am used to from staying at other hotels/inns. The carpet showed alot of wear but it didn't bother me. My room had a full size bathtub and I got a side view facing the construction site of what appears to be another hotel being built and facing the parking lot/pool view which I was not bothered by. I did get woken up by a Ravens marching band and could not move my car until they were gone which know this is probably a one time obstacle. When I arrived on a weekday, it was like off-season so it was interesting to see the traffic coming in on the weekend. I liked how the lobby opened out to the boardwalk with rocking chairs facing the boardwalk/ocean and what a view and great if you like to watch people on the boardwalk. The coffee was excellent and they even had flavored creamer and sweetener substitute whcih I did not expect as most non-chain establishments do not have and the only way I can enjoy coffee. The staff was friendly and I spoke to them frequently and they were not grumpy as you might expect and very courteous. I used my dinner voucher to eat at Da'Vinci's Italian Restaurant underneathe the hotel which was convenient and although pricey was very good. I agree this hotel does need to renovate but money is tight for everyone. Maybe they will one day. I do not recall seeing any comment cards anywhere like I normally do at other hotels/inns. Parking was great for me because I never moved my car during my stay and arrived before the weekend crowd. The pool appeared clean and was olympic sized. The elevators were too small for one person with a luggage cart and myself but I managed to squeeze inside. It needs to be bigger and it stops on every floor even if the elevator goes up and you are going down which was a nusiance and may need repaired or better yet a new elevator. I stayed on the 2nd floor which worked great when going out to the boardwalk. There are not many hotels that open up to the boardwalk other than the Plim Plaza which I liked how this is layed out. This hotels reminds me more like a big guesthouse and it felt small and tight when walking down the hallway. It kinda feels like you're in an Amtrak which I got the feeling at first with how narrow the hallway is and how the doors looked. I liked how the key was very easy to open the door to the room, just stick it in, wait..hear the click and the light is lit then you're in. I didn't need maid service and the room and bathroom although is older was very clean and the toilet had a powerful flush. I guess I got lucky go ask for room #217 and you'll be happy. The bed felt comfortable although my back hurt probably from lying on a cheap innerspring mattress and felt somewhat too soft and maybe its just me, not the mattress as everyone has a different preference. I am looking forward to returning to utilize their customer appreciation days in September @ a rate of $10 per night for sideview or $15 for oceanview. You don't need to waste gas looking for parking when you can ride the tram or the short walk to the other end of the boardwalk. I considered the Carousel Resort and Pricess Royal Hotels which were similarly priced due to the slow season with high gas prices and poor economy and although are probably much nicer did not offer the convenience of the location you get from this hotel or free meals as an incentive. I did not see any bugs at this hotel which is a real positive. This hotel at 15th St. & Boardwalk is a great location and worth it for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan9
Reviews.Content: Night 1: Upon arrival we checked into a 2 bed standard room. We dropped our luggage off and went out and didn't return until late. That night we returned and TRIED to sleep in the beds. It seemed like there was a gigantic HOLE in the center b/c the center was so saggy, I don't think the mattresses had been replaced since it opened in 1951. The next morning we saw that the bathtub faucets were broken, there was NO hot water, and hair was ALL OVER the place. It was DISGUSTING. The desk people were nice when I insisited on being moved. They moved us into a king bed, oceanfront view, which was much nicer, although hot water was a challenge and the shower stall was horribly small.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Slum! Stay away”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTimeLarry
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a big favor and stay elsewhere. The owners (Harrison Group) should be embarrassed to run a hotel in this condition. This is easily the worst hotel at which I've ever stayed. It should be illegal to rent rooms in this condition. We were lured in by a decent nightly rate, only to discover that we made a big mistake. This place is about on par with camping; only camping is a little cleaner. The place looks to be about 100 years old and very little time and money is spent on upkeep. Carpets are old, dirty and torn. Our room was tiny and the bathroom was even smaller and in a horrible state of disrepair: Mold everywhere, numerous tiles missing, sink and shower not working properly, no hot water, the door wouldn’t close. And one could easily see into the next room through the HVAC vents that were aligned. I felt like I couldn’t touch anything or walk barefooted for fear of contracting a disease of some sort. On the plus side: The location is good and convenient with plenty of parking. The hotel looks quaint, although only from the outside. It has a nice large wrap-around porch from where you can watch board walkers and the ocean from rocking chairs. And there was fruit and coffee available in the Lobby. The staff was friendly and courteous although we didn't report any problems to them. In short, this place needs more than a lot of repair; it needs to be completely gutted or razed and rebuilt. The Harrison group is a slumlord. Spend a few more bucks and stay somewhere else… anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice place for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: alw2007
Reviews.Content: The Harrison Hall isn't a fancy, overpriced hotel. It's plain, maybe a little outdated, and cheap. It's also right on the boardwalk! If you're expecting something like the Hilton, then your expectations are too high. My family and I don't spend a lot of time in our room while at the beach. We sleep and shower there, that's it. The service was great, the staff was friendly and accomodating and our room was cleaned every single day. I have no complaints. If you want a nice, quaint, cheap hotel on the boardwalk, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “This whole place SUCKS !”
Reviews.Author: Jerzejoe1
Reviews.Content: I give this place one thing and one thing ONLY....."Peppers" is right there. What a horrible stay. The only reason I look at this dump when I walk by ( on my way to "Peppers" ), is I might buy it; so I can completely renovate it to the way a hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “They've got to be KIDDING me.”
Reviews.Author: Jerzejoe
Reviews.Content: Nice looking old place, from outside. Very good location. The room...well, this closet size room was VERY loud and uncomfortable. Moldy smelling hallways and rooms. The bathroom door did'nt close due to a warped floor. The shower did NOT have hot water. IT DID'NT FRIGGIN HAVE HOT WATER. I counted 8 4" tiles across and width in the shower. Thats 32" square. Try taking a FREEZING cold shower in a prison cell size shower. I actually hit my head on the wall when I went to wash my feet. This place SUCKS. I'll never stay here again and I suggest you don't either.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PAbeachgoer
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last summer (2006) and it was old and outdated but clean so I thought it would be ok to stay there again this summer but boy was I wrong. The room was well let me say it left alot to be desired, the shower and thats all it had was a shower well it was approximately 2 x 2, the bathroom was nasty, when you would open the curtains and close them they would come off the curtain rods, the sheets were to small for the bed so that when you would move they would come off the bed and if you weren't careful you were laying on the mattress, the a/c worked just fine but that doesn't mean to much when the rest of the room is nasty. The only thing this place has going for it is its pool and front porch, which neither were cleaned on a daily basis, the pool had sand in it which can be expected at the beach but the porch floor was always sticky and garbage from the evening before was still there the next day. They really need to give this place an overhaul. I had also made reservations for their customer appreciation days which I have cancelled since having been there in July.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for a Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: turtlegal09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harrison Hall in September 2007 and I must say that after I read all the negative reviews I was excepting the worst. I was pleased to find that it is not as bad as what I had visualized. The staff was very friendly. The porch and lobby was very nice. Yes the rooms are small but they were clean. I did not have problems with the hot/cold water. One thing I would mention for people who have small children is that most of the rooms only have 3'x3' showers. We were excepting that so we brought a baby bathtub for our 3 year old and it worked just fine for her. I have stayed in a number of hotels in Ocean City since we have coming here for about 22 years. For the price and location this hotel is perfect for people on a budget. I have stayed in hotels that have cost more money and have found it to be dirty and things looking outdated. If you are expecting a brand new 5 star hotel then I would suggest staying somewhere else maybe the giant hotel they are building beside of it. If you want to stay in a piece of history from Ocean City then this hotel will be give you the "old time" feel. Too many of these "old" hotels are being demolished so that a huge, fansy hotels can be built. The reason we go to Ocean City is to be around the history. It is sad so much of it is being tore down.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: gosavi
Reviews.Content: Positives: The location is good...right on the boardwalk, just far enough away from the hustle of the boardwalk further down (I brought my family so that was important). The price is 2x cheaper than any boardwalk hotel. If you like to people watch, I guess this place is probably the cheapest you'll find. It has a decent pool with a bar. Rooms have a fridge so you can stash your beer or food. The staff there is friendly. There's a decent Italian restaurant (Davinci's) right underneath...although i didn't eat there, it looked good. Negatives: Hot water was hit or miss, which is not a good thing with young children. We asked about this and they said it's been like this all summer and they don't know what's wrong. Well, I'm not a plumber, but I'm guessing THEY SHOULD PROBABLY REPLACE THE HOT WATER HEATERS?! The shower in our room smelled rotten whenever we turned it on. Rooms are outdated and very small. You can't drink alcohol on the porch, but I just put it in a container and no one bothered me. If you can get a room like my sister-inlaw did (one of the side rooms with 2 double beds) then you should be fine. For some reason, they had hot water the whole time and a nice bathroom with a tub. Otherwise, I'd suggest looking at one of the other hotels back from the boardwalk a bit...although most OC hotels aren't a whole lot better. My guess is, this hotel will never be updated. I'm sure it's been paid off years ago and all the business they get now is just cash flowing in. They will probably wait for some bigger fish to come by and offer them a whole lotta cash for this location. This is probably our last time in OC anyway...it's just not a great place for a family vacation. I enjoyed it much more when I was younger. The Senior Week kids and singles can have their OC. Tips: There's a really good hole-in-the-wall crabshack nearby...Crab-Stop. Get a dozen take-out and eat in the lobby of the Harrison and you got ocean front AYCE crabs for cheap! Trust me...a dozen crabs is all you need. I had my beer in my room and refilled my cup as needed ;) It cost me less than $20 for the crabs and it was way better Higgins.

Reviews.Title: “fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: genberry
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very busy and quaint. The halls were small and narrow, and yes, everything needed to be redone, i.e. carpets and walls. The lobby area was very nice with complimentary drinks and board games. The front porch was awesome...right on the boardwalk with rocking chairs - a nice place to relax and people watch. Our room was on the 5th floor Ocean view on the corner. Great location, no noise problems - excellent view. The AC worked well, nice big tv, it was a typical hotel room. The carpet and everything could have been newer but it didn't matter that much to me since we were only there for a night. The shower was TERRIBLE. Worst shower we've ever taken. At first we didn't think the hot water worked so we called maintenance - who showed up 40 minutes later after we figured it out. The temperature was very touchy...you would get it hot and then it would start to get reallly hot, and then you would turn it down and it would be freezing. And very little water pressure. Parking was weird..you have to park a few blocks away because everything else is taken. Not bothersome, though. The pool looked nice, we didn't get a chance to use it. All in all, the price was right and the location was AMAZING. If you're planning on being out most of the time then this is a fine place to stay. I would only recommend it for short stays!

Reviews.Title: “Oh boy what a mistake!”
Reviews.Author: yuppypuppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and 4 days. Wished we wouldn't have stayed there at all. The room smelled horrible, the refrigerator didn't cool, the bathroom was awful. The bathtub water wouldn't shut off, the hot water faucet on it did a 360 and wouldn't shut off. Taking a shower you froze one second and got your skin scalded off the next. There wasn't an exhaust in the bathroom just a hole where it should have been, and that hole led to the next floor up in another room where you could hear everything going on in their bathroom!! The toliet lid screeched everytime you opened it so we just left it open at night so we wouldn't wake anyone up. The beds were clean though. The hallways are wavy and crooked and the hallway walls have big dinges in them.The side view was bad out the window it looked down on a landing that had oodles of cigarette butts and dirt in all the corners. The elevator smelled like burnt wiring and one time we were brave enough to get on it, it got stuck with only the inner doors shutting. Talk about scary. We took the steps the rest of the stay. The ice from the machine on the 4th floor tasted dirty, old and musty. The porch was about the only nice thing there. The pool was packed as long as the bar was open and I'm sure there were manypeople using it that weren't guests of the hotel. The pool was sandy and the pool furniture was dirty and dingy. The parking is really bad. They don't tell you half their parking lot is two blocks down where you have to cross traffic. What makes it bad is they don't tell you that til you get there and it's like first come first serve. And many cars that parked there weren't the hotel guests vehicles. They were just peoples' cars who parked there and went onto the boardwalk for the day. Be on the lookout for the fruit because they don't tell you where it is. I guess I thought paying prices like we did for staying on the boardwalk it would have been nicer than it was but.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: hepcat77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Harrison Hall. We were on the 5th floor with an ocean view from the front window and a good view of the boardwalk from the side window (rm 505). The room was very nice with a little bit of a need for some paint (the paint was chipped off, especially on the closet shelf where sometimes it caused paint chips to get on our clothes). The only real problem we had was with water presssure (too little) and while taking a shower the water would suddenly become very cold and then go back to hot. The pool was nice. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We love Harrison Hall!”
Reviews.Author: mryan1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I discovered Harrison Hall a few years ago, when we lived in Baltimore and were looking for a moderately priced place to stay in Ocean City. I'm happy to say that for the last three years we've been going to this old hotel and we've always been pleased with it. Of course, it certainly isn't fancy, and could definitely use a renovation. But, put simply, you get what you pay for. For half the price of most other hotels you are able to stay right there on the boardwalk. One year we found that the room we were given had no hot water. I quickly called the front desk and they not only moved us to another room - they upgraded our room to an Oceanfront view. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. Its a family-oriented hotel and as such remains pretty quiet. My husband and I think that its a charming old place and we have every intention of continuing to stay at Harrison Hall when we head to the ocean for our yearly vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shortee18
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the other reviews I've read. I was looking for a place on the boardwalk, not too expensive, for a wknd getaway w/my boyfriend. I found this place & decided to go w/it. Yes, it's an older place, but so is Ocean City. Check in was great. We got there around 1 & the room wasn't ready yet (check in is 3). The receptionist said she would call me when the room is available. About 20 min later, she called me. They do offer parking on the street side, but it's usually taken by people on the beach. There's parking behind the hotel, next to the pool & accross the street. We got just a double bed room, since it was only the two of us. Yes it was small, but it had a tv w/cable, a mini fridge, dresser & a separate bthrm. The bthrm was a little old & the shower stall was tiny. The room was clean tho. Yes the decor is kinda old fashion, but again this is an old hotel. House cleaning was very pleasant as well as the other hotel employees. I've seen other rooms & they all looked decent & were bigger than ours. The elevator was slow, but again this is an older hotel (be thankful b/c most hotels don't have one). This hotel could use some upgrades & maybe some modern design but overall I liked this hotel. It was directly on the boardwalk & had a bigger pool, than most newer hotels. We stayed at a condo w/our children in June & this hotel offered more & was definitely comparable! The price was awesome too! If you're looking for a resort type hotel, go to the Carribean or Mexico. You're not going to find it at any hotel in Ocean City. If you're looking for an enjoyable stay, I would definitely recommend this hotel! I would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not 'quite' as bad as everyone else is making it seem...”
Reviews.Author: scott4000
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to take a vacation to D.C. and Ocean City, MD one week prior to making any plans. I checked out the Ocean CIty, MD website for hotels and discovered Harrison Hall, one of, if not the, cheapest hotel listed on the site. I checked out the reviews and they were absolutely horrible - one even said, "do not stay here!!!" However, we did anyway. I like staying in nice places, and prefer great service, etc., but if you're on a tight budget and are just looking for somewhere to stay, this place is absolutely perfect. The front desk service was fine, nothing out of the ordinary. We checked in 3 hours prior to check in time and they did not have a problem with that. The hotel is about 3-stories, and has the slowest elevator ever. (so plan on taking the stairs). The decor is so-so. There is nothing at all special about this place (other than the price and location). It has a restaurant attached called Di Vinci's or something like that. We didn't have a chance to eat there, but I'm sure it was overpriced and mediocre at best. The swimming pool is decent, but not if you're used to enormous resort-style pools. It is the equivalent to a nice back-yard inground pool. The only drawback is that it is in the parking lot of hotel, and not beach-side. There was also construction going on immediately next door to the pool (July 2007). I don't imagine that being there next year, but who knows. There is a bar in the pool are which is nice. They offer decently priced beer and frozen drinks. It is opened at random times, it follows no schedule it seems... The hotel is also right on the boardwalk at 15th street. This is good location because it is near the end of the busy-part of the boardwalk, so the beach is not incredibly crowded at this point. The hotel has a large porch which overlooks the boardwalk and beach, and is frequented by the elderly and middle-agers. If you're willing to walk 1-3 miles, you can easily make it down to the end of the boardwalk and back within a couple hours. The billing for the hotel was reasonable, no bad practices, no hidden charges - everything went fine there. Check in and check out were fine also. Parking is a pain - you can unload your car right next to the hotel, however, will most likely part across a street in a hotel designiated lot (not the main street however). The rooms are probably the worst part of the hotel. They are incredibly small, old and not the cleanest. The bathroom has not been renovated in decades I'm sure. The shower is literally 3 ft by 3 ft - I measured, so if you're on the larger side, you may not fit. The water temperature seemed to also frequently change as well?? The air conditioning is so-so, television fine. Beds you may want to spray down with Lysol, but they're typical for your run of the mill motel. In closing, don't go here if you're expecting a romantic or exotic get-away. You'll be dissappointed. However, if you want a cheaper, but decent hotel in a good location, and you don't plan on spending much time in the room, then this is the place for you. You get what you pay for I guess??? Hope this helps!! e-mail me with any questions! ~Scott

Reviews.Title: “False advertising”
Reviews.Author: tvspad
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Ocean City Md a day earlier then we had planned to. We had reservations at another hotel for the week. The other hotel we had booked in February. They did not have a room available for the extra night. I looked in our OC brochure and saw Harrison Hall. It looked nice so I called and booked the night I needed. When we pulled up I got a little worried. When we got in to our room I couldn't believe how run down and old everything was. I was very upset. The furniture is old and scratched. The wallpaper was peeling in areas. The rug in the entire hotel was dirty and horrible. The fire sprinkler was covered with dust. The bathroom was terrible. Tiles were missing and the toilet was very old. The whole hotel looked like it hadn't been updated in 30 years. It more or less ruined our first day of our vacation. Please take my advice and do not stay here. I agree with the other review, I would've preferred to have slept in my car than there!!!! Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location! Awesome outdoor pool! Good Service!”
Reviews.Author: lgroman
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked my reservation at this hotel before looking at the reviews here. After reading the reviews I was a little scare about the decision but since I had to make a deposit I went ahead as planned. My family (wife, child 4yr old, mother-in-law) and I arrived July 3rd, 07. Our rate was $149 when everyone else was either sold out or $300+ a night. The first thing, parking... they do have a parking lot that is reserved for guests only... so that was great. The hotel is right off the boardwalk and the beach so the arrival experience was beautiful. The hotel has about 25 rocking chairs in their big balcony that are facing the beach. The lobby is comfortable...they have several couches, chairs, a TV mostly with news, board games for kids, complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and tea... these were always available and fresh during my stay. The check-in process was very smooth and staff was very friendly. The elevator is very small but worked great during our stay. The hallways are very small, some with peeling wallpaper (as you might expect from an old historic hotel). When we arrived to our guest room everything was in order. Fresh smell, clean carper, great view, a/c working properly. The conditions of the wall (especially in the bathroom) were not very good. We had problems with hot water...if you put the shower the water temperature will fluctuate so we had to use the water from the lower faucet which was always hot (so we used a little cup to bath). Towels were clean and fresh and they provided with branded soaps and shampoo/ conditioner. There was a closet in the room, refrigerator and TV with Cable. The beds were very comfortable and very clean. The hotel has a huge Olympic outdoor pool on the back (from 3ft deep to 10ft...) they also have a kiddy pool... the pool was great. A little dirty on the steps to get in but what else can you expect when the hotel is sitting right off the beach? They have a lot of chairs and a bar right off the pool serving soft drinks, beers, frozen drinks and food...I had a pina colada :)... Well, overall it was a great experience...and the location really makes up for the challenges that the property has from a renovation needs standpoint. If you are going to Ocean City to sleep and be in the hotel all day then this is not your hotel...but if you are going to Ocean City to enjoy the beach, the boardwalk, the activities, the restaurants then take a bath, and sleep for the next day...this your place and for a great rate...

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible experience!!! Please read before you stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: alysonsdaddy
Reviews.Content: This place is nothing like it advertises or seems!! Our first impression was - what a nice place to stay. It has a beautiful front porch with large rocking chairs overlooking the ocean - then we walked inside!! The lobby (like the whole place) is in need of a major makeover and seems really dated but hey, maybe our room is nice - HAH!!! The hallway leading to our room featured stained and worn out carpet and wallpaper that was extremely worn and dirty. Our room featured a smoke detector that was dangling from the ceiling - not even sure if it worked. The support, from the ceiling, that was holding up the shower curtain was pulling away from the wall. The faucet handles pulled right off of the sink. The heat lamp, in the bathroom, was falling out of the wall. The backwall, above the toilet, had water leaking down from the upstairs bathroom and the rust stains proved that this problem was there for quite awhile. The bathroom sink had no vanity what-so-ever and the room itself had an odd smell. What would you expect for $110 per night early in the season. This place gets $150-180 in the peak season!! We went to the front desk to complain and were shown 3 other rooms to try to satisfy us. One room featured a clogged toilet with the previous tenants crap floating in it!!! Another room was not too bad, but didn't feature a bath tub, which my 4 year old needed. The final room that was shown to us - the manager went with us as I guess he though we were making all of this stuff up. When he entered the room he tried to turn on the lights and they wouldn't work - a little embarrassing for him. The toilet seat looked like it was 100 years old. It featured old, cracked and chipping paint and looked stained. I wouldn't have my dog use that toilet!! The manager then said to us "I'll leave it to you guys to discuss." What was to discuss?!! Thankfully this "hotel" was part of a chain and we wound up staying at another partner hotel just up the boardwalk!! This is a classic example that not all income can be profit - You have to spend money to make money. I cannot believe that this place gets any return visits!! AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would have rather slept in my car than here.”
Reviews.Author: LACap
Reviews.Content: The first thing that you will notice is the gorgeous, large front porch right on the boardwalk, overlooking the ocean with rocking chairs. This is where we should have stopped. Upon closer examination the stairs are cracked with chucks of wood missing and all needed a paint job. The lobby was very dated but not horrible. The hallways leading to our room had worn dirty carpets, the floor moldings had worn paint with wallpaper peeling off the walls. Upon entering the room there was a distinct unpleasant cleaning product smell. OK, it's small but we were only there for 2 days. Forget the decor, "old" would sum it up nicely. The linens appeared clean, we could manage. The we went into the bathroom. The light fixture didn't work, to replace it we had a heating light fixture on a timer that shone right into your face when you were on the toilet. The medicine cabinet and air vent were rusted. The hot and cold water faucets were backwards. The shower head came up to the middle of my forehead and I had to bend down to wash my hair with water pressure that was almost nonexistent. The worst part of the whole bathroom was the floor. It literally had a hole in it with the head of a nail poking through with a piece of duct tape over it! Going up to the next floor to get ice, the machince was recessed into a wall, the machine leaked and you "squished" in the carpet in front of it. We decided to ask for another room but on our way down to the lobby we passed 2 other rooms that were being cleaned and peaked inside to find pretty much the same conditions in those rooms too. The best thing I could say about the place was that the staff was friendly and the pool was nice. Otherwise you would be better off staying somewhere else. This place needs a major makeover!

Reviews.Title: “"Ehhhhhhh..."”
Reviews.Author: LttlRed
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here this past 4th of July. We picked it because of the location (on the boardwalk, about halfway down, so pretty perfect) and price ($171/night, which during 4th of July you are hard-pressed to find a boardwalk hotel under $200). Some things were better than others. The room itself was small, but not as small as I was imagining based on reviews that I'd read. That may have partly have been because we'd gotten a corner room with a queen bed. The bed was a little annoying - the sheets were too small to fit the bed and the mattress pad kept rumpling up under the sheets. The bathroom was tiny - My boyfriend could barely fit in the shower and the water pressure was horrible. I didn't have too much of a temperature problem, though. The pool looked nice although we didn't go in, it was nice to have fresh fruit provided every morning, and the room was pretty clean. I probably wouldn't go back as I'm used to nicer accomodations, but it was fine for what we needed. The only time we really spent in the room was at night for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if all you're doing there is sleeping”
Reviews.Author: princess3182
Reviews.Content: We booked harrison hall because of it's perfect location and really really low price (compartively speaking). All of the other reviews you see are right on target. You get what you pay for! The room did smell, the shower was small, the furniture was old and nasty looking, the whole place needed to be updated. But in truth, the sole purpose for us staying at a hotel was to shower and sleep there. The shower was tiny, and the tiles were gross (i ended up wearing flip flops in the shower) and the biggest issue was water temperature and pressure. I have long hair so it took me 30 minutes to take a shower when normally it only takes 10. The water would go from hot to cold and sometimes it would trickle and sometimes it would have a little more force. Here's the bottom line, we only stayed two nights, (i don't think i could have handled any more) but it's perfect if all you're doing there is sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eclipse_grl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harrison Hall for labor day weekend.....It was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!! I get to OC alot and stayed at numerous hotels, but this was very bad!! looking at it online did not look like it at all.!!! False advertisement. First of all it is a very old hotel and it should be torn down. The evlevators are sooooo old it takes for every to get anywhere. The rooms are sooooo dirty and outdated. I was afraid to lay on the sheets, fearing what would be under them. The pool outside was really dirty, I don't think it was cleaned since it was put in. I would sleep in my car before I would stay there again!!!!!! GROSS

Reviews.Title: “Please don't even think about staying here”
Reviews.Author: Jason7785
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harrison Hall in June of 2003 for one night. After reading some of the reviews they are right on the money. Don't waste your money on this hotel it's a joke. The room is tiny and I didn't even use the shower. Honestly the shower scared me. In all the hotels I've stayed at I have never seen a shower like that one. I really think its the original from the 50's , I'm not kidding. Also the seniors were so bad and noisy that I didn't fall asleep till 3 or 4. The hotel actually shook. I can't believe no one in the hotel called the police. When I went down to complain and try to get my money back all I got from the woman at the desk was sarcasm. She said what did I expect with the junebugs in town. So I waited for the manager to come in and I think it was around 8am. I was hopping mad by this time. He wouldn't refund my wife and I for that night. But the second night that we had payed for he sent us to one of their other properties which was very nice. I think it was the Day's Inn. The Harrison group owns like 6 or 7 other hotels in oc. That room was really nice and the price I payed was valid for there. If you want to enjoy your vacation do not stay here no matter how cheap it is. That year they had a promotion that if you stayed at the Harrison Hall you could come back in September or October for $10 or $15 a night. They called it customer appreciaton weeks or something like that. Even at that price I said no thanks. I would rather pitch a tent on the beach or dig a hole and stay there till the police show up.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Like the Brochure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's (boyfriend at the time) first time to the beach and I wanted everything to be perfect. When I got the brochure for the Harrison Hall it look like one of those old cute little victorian places by the ocean. Boy was I wrong! The whole place smelled smokey and musty. The room was the size of a postage stamp. The bathroom was terrible; water pressure was a trickle. Coming back from the beach the first thing you usually do is take a shower and we couldn't even do that. We did like the pool though. The ocean was great as well as the boardwalk. Do extensive research when booking a hotel in Ocean City. Don't trust the properties websight or brochure. I just wish I knew about trip advisor when I was planning this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Harrison Hall for the past three years.In 2002, we had no problems of any kind. Last year, there was a problem with our air conditioner but it was fixed promptly. This year, everything was in working order and the only complaint I have is that housekeeping didn't do a very good job. One day, we returned to the room after receiving service and the bath tub was still full of sand. Obviously, the bathroom had not been cleaned. We did have clean towels but that was all that was done to the bathroom. The staff has always been helpful and pleasant. Reservations have been handled without incident. I have enjoyed my stays there and will likely stay there again. I'm hoping the bathroom this year was an abberation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from August 27-30th, 2004 and, this place was absolutely horrible!!! At first, I thought "OK, this is a dump, but we can deal with it". It only got worse after that. The room was dirty and stunk, the bathroom had hair in the sink and on the toilet, and the shower was so tiny you could barely move, and after taking a shower I think I felt dirtier than before. The sheets were stained, and the hallways were horrible. And the elevator, what a joke!!!! But the worst part of the weekend was our last night/morning there. It was my one year old daughters first time away from home, so she was having trouble sleeping, and was crying non stop. Since we were going to check out the following morning anyhow, we decided to leave around 2:30 am. After we got the car all packed, we went to the front desk. No one was there. All the doors coming into the hotel were unlocked (including the one that says it locks from 11-7, yeah right), so we knew someone was to be at that desk. We stood there for an hour and half, ringing the bell, knocking on the counter and the office door, and yelling for someone. My husband even went back up to the room and called numerous times, no one would come. Finally, this lady comes walking out rubbing her eyes, and says sorry for the wait, I was on the phone. Ummm...hello. At this time it was 4:00 am, and when I told her we were there for more than an hour her face turned bright red and she had no comment. I will never, ever stay at this place again. The front porch was pretty, but very dirty with cigarette butts laying around. And the olympic size pool and pool bar, what a joke. The kiddie pool was green and had an inch of sand in the bottom. I wouldn't even consider putting my daughter in there. Not once during the 3 days I was there did you see anyone out there cleaning the pool. I wish I would have found this website before, so I could've enjoyed my vacation. I just hope I can save someone else from wasting their money. I'm counting my days till next summer so I can have a real vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!! Should be called Harrison Hell!!”
Reviews.Author: pointe3579
Reviews.Content: At first when my friend and I stayed here two years ago, I orginally did not know about trip advisor's website. It was after I stayed at Harrison Hall for the first time that I found trip advisor. As I read the reviews, I thought back to our stay and said to myself it was decent and I did understand why people were so unhappy there. Forward to this year and our return trip to Ocean City and my friend and I were happy to be staying in a place where we knew what to expect or so we thought. We were supposed to stay this year from August 25th to the 29th. We arrived late Wednesday night at about 10 pm after a three hour trip from Baltimore, so needless to say we were pretty tired. My friend had booked us a double room with an oceanview. We got to our room after checking in and I am glad we did not unload our things till we saw the room. The windows top pane were both stuck, so there was bugs flying in the room. The light knob for the two beds lamps looked as if it could fall out at any second. There were rips in the curtains and chairs in the room. There was mildew on the curtain of the shower and the shower was so tiny that a child could probably barely move in it. There was a ring of brown stuff around the sink drain and the toliet was dirty. I did not look at the sheets, but my friend and I were afraid to sleep in the beds after everything else. We went to the front desk to complain and were told that all other oceanview rooms were booked, but there was another room we could see instead. This second room was almost as bad as the first only slightly better. It was a side room with one double bed and one twin bed, not what we originally asked for. It was hard to believe that this place was full. We told the front desk that we would take the second room with the promise of returning to an ocean front after another couple checked out in the morning. We were also told that we were orginally given a smoking room, when we had requested a non-smoking. We tried to get a third floor room where we had stayed two years ago, but got told that they were all booked. Bottom line is you get what you pay for. We ended up driving up Coastal Highway a few blocks and staying at the Grand. It was so much better. (I posted a review in the Grand section as well) We had to forfeit one nights deposit for leaving Wednesday night, but it was worth it. Should have believed the trip advisor reviews before booking this hotel a second time, but now my friend and I know never to stay here again. I am surprised that this hotel has lasted as long with service and rooms like the one my friend and I almost stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Dump!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place was a dump. I have traveled for many years and have never stayed at a place like this. As soon as I walked in the door, I knew how filthy it was. The hallways were dirty and the whole placed smelled very musty. If I could have afforded to loose our money, I would have switched motels, but they would not give me back a refund. The bathroom was disgusting- our toliet was plugged, only one light worked, no hot water and the tub was dirty. We had to call three times the 2nd day we were there for maid service - they finally sent somebody up at 8:00 at night. The brochure is very misleading - and notice there is not any pictures of the rooms in the brochure. How disappointing!!!

Reviews.Title: “The owners of this hotel live in a 3rd world country”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to begin.... Walking up to the third floor, the carpet smelled like moldy urine. The wallpaper was duct taped, and the paint was falling off the walls. Upon entering the room, the odor was horrendous. We immediately walked around the boardwalk to search for a candle to dilute the odor. When attempting to take a shower, since there is no tub, we had to clean off what looked like a barber shop floor of hair all over the walls and shower. When you turn the shower on, the knob fell off along with the old rusty screw that was attempting to keep it in place. Not to mension the 3x3 foot shower with no water pressure. Women, you cant shave your legs in there. The sink was green and full of corrosion. The drain had old caps of tothpaste in it, and who knows what else. The bed is another story in itself. The mattress is 40 years old, and the torn stretched out fitted sheet wouldnt stay on the mattress. Upon refixing the sheet several times, you cant help but notice the hair inbetween the mattress and boxspring. The ceilings in the halls and room were cracked, stained, and falling in. The floors are uneven. Upon checking out, they attempted to charge us for phone calls we didnt make. Parking is a joke. If you like to walk, this place is for you. The picture on the internet shows you a nice hotel, from the outside. Ever wonder why they dont show you inside pictures of the room??? The lobby is the only nice thing about that place. Oh, and the porch. We only stayed here for 2 nights for a meeting, and were thinking about leaving. If we were there for a week, we would have checked out after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Was pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very reluctant to stay here after reading some of the posts, but my experience was pleasant. We arrived early and the clerk at the desk let us check in early and gave us a parking pass so we wouldn't loose our parking spot. I thought that was nice of him to do so. Our room was clean and the bathroom looked like it had been recently remodeled complete with a pedastal sink! The door to the room could have been in a little better shape. It wasn't flush with the door frame. We discovered two light bulbs out and within two minutes of reporting it we had replacement bulbs. The beds were comfortable, staff was nice, and it is a great location on the boardwalk. For the price we paid I would stay there again. If you are expecting a chain hotel experience you might be dissapointed. This place was built in the 1950's, but I think it has held up well considering how many people have stayed here over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Harrison hell!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING!!! This was the filthiest place I have ever seen. If I had my dog, I would not have let him sleep on the floor. The web site and the brochure are a SCAM!! After staying one night, we asked to be moved to another room because our first room had such a terrible odor from the air conditioner leaking on the floor - oh, and the lights didn't work. The shower in the second room had a two inch layer of black soap scum and hair of past visitors. We wore flip flops in our shower!! Our toilet leaked and the doors were so flimsy that locking them was a joke!! When we complained to management, they asked if we wanted to move rooms - AGAIN! We have sent complaint letters to Harrison Hall, The Harrison Group and OCMD Chamber of Commerce. We'll see if there is a response.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price of the room and the location on the boardwalk, I thought it was a very nice place to stay. I took my mother and my son and we all had a great time. The rocking chairs on the porch were a great touch and comfortable to sit on and watch the ocean. Rooms are a little small, but really you only need to sleep there, right. Staff was friendly and always willing to help.

HotelInfo.Name: Harrison Hall
HotelInfo.Address: On the boardwalk at 15th Street, Oceanfront & 15th St., Ocean City, MD
